          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          jq -r '.verified[] | "- [\(.url)](\(.url))"' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md 2>/dev/null || echo "No apps verified yet." >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          
      - name: Commit results
        run: |
          git config --local user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git config --local user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          
          git add ecosystem/ || true
          git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "Update ecosystem compliance results [skip ci]"
          git push || true

        run: |
          echo "## Compliance Verification Complete" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

+             ### What This Means
+

+

+             - Puter browser bookmarks
+             - Cross-app integration
+             - Revenue sharing

+

+             1. **Remove external methods** - Remove all external donation buttons, payment links, and FUNDING.yml to restore ecosystem eligibility
+             2. **Accept opt-out** - Keep external methods and forfeit ecosystem benefits
+             
+             ### Appeal
+             
+             If you believe this is a false positive, please comment on this issue with an explanation.
+

+

+                   owner: context.repo.owner,
+                   repo: context.repo.repo,
+                   title: title,
+                   body: body,
+                   labels: ['compliance-violation', 'automated']
+                 });
+                 
+                 console.log(`Created issue for: ${violation.url}`);
+               }

+ ","oldStart":1,"newStart":1,"oldLines":1,"newLines":259,"linesRemoved":1,"linesAdded":259}],"editor":"EDITOR_AI"},"shouldAutoFixLints":true,"resultForModel":"Wrote contents to .github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml.","contentsAfterEdit":"name: Verify Ecosystem Compliance

on:
  schedule:
    # Run daily at midnight UTC
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      specific_app:
        description: 'Specific app URL to verify (optional)'
        required: false
        type: string

permissions:
  contents: write
  issues: write

jobs:
  verify-compliance:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          
      - name: Fetch ecosystem registry
        id: fetch-registry
        run: |
          echo "Fetching registered apps from ecosystem registry..."
          
          # Create ecosystem directory if it doesn't exist
          mkdir -p ecosystem
          
          # Try to fetch existing registry, or create empty one
          if [ -f "ecosystem/registry.json" ]; then
            echo "Using existing registry"
          else
            echo '{"apps":[],"lastUpdated":"'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"}' > ecosystem/registry.json
          fi
          
          # Count registered apps
          APP_COUNT=$(jq '.apps | length' ecosystem/registry.json)
          echo "app_count=$APP_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
      - name: Run compliance verification
        id: verify
        run: |
          echo "Running compliance verification..."
          
          # Create results directory
          mkdir -p ecosystem/compliance-results
          
          # Initialize results
          echo '{"verified":[],"violations":[],"errors":[],"timestamp":"'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"}' > ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
          
          # Check if we have a specific app to verify
          SPECIFIC_APP="${{ github.event.inputs.specific_app }}"
          
          if [ -n "$SPECIFIC_APP" ]; then
            echo "Verifying specific app: $SPECIFIC_APP"
            node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js "$SPECIFIC_APP" --json > /tmp/result.json 2>&1 || true
            
            # Check result
            if jq -e '.compliant == true' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
              echo "App is COMPLIANT"
              jq --arg url "$SPECIFIC_APP" '.verified += [{"url": $url, "timestamp": now | todate}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
              mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
            else
              echo "App has VIOLATIONS"
              FINDINGS=$(jq -c '.findings' /tmp/result.json 2>/dev/null || echo '[]')
              jq --arg url "$SPECIFIC_APP" --argjson findings "$FINDINGS" '.violations += [{"url": $url, "findings": $findings, "timestamp": now | todate}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
              mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
            fi
          else
            echo "Verifying all registered apps..."
            
            # Iterate through registered apps
            jq -r '.apps[].url' ecosystem/registry.json 2>/dev/null | while read -r APP_URL; do
              if [ -n "$APP_URL" ]; then
                echo "Checking: $APP_URL"
                
                # Run detection (with timeout)
                timeout 30 node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js "$APP_URL" --json > /tmp/result.json 2>&1 || true
                
                # Process result
                if jq -e '.compliant == true' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" '.verified += [{"url": $url}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                elif jq -e '.error' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                  ERROR_MSG=$(jq -r '.error' /tmp/result.json)
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" --arg err "$ERROR_MSG" '.errors += [{"url": $url, "error": $err}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                else
                  FINDINGS=$(jq -c '.findings' /tmp/result.json 2>/dev/null || echo '[]')
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" --argjson findings "$FINDINGS" '.violations += [{"url": $url, "findings": $findings}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                fi
              fi
            done
          fi
          
          # Generate summary
          VERIFIED_COUNT=$(jq '.verified | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          VIOLATION_COUNT=$(jq '.violations | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          ERROR_COUNT=$(jq '.errors | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          
          echo "verified_count=$VERIFIED_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "violation_count=$VIOLATION_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "error_count=$ERROR_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
      - name: Update compliance registry
        run: |
          echo "Updating compliance status in registry..."
          
          # Read violations
          VIOLATIONS=$(jq -r '.violations[].url' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json 2>/dev/null || echo "")
          
          # Update registry with compliance status
          for VIOLATION_URL in $VIOLATIONS; do
            if [ -n "$VIOLATION_URL" ]; then
              echo "Marking as non-compliant: $VIOLATION_URL"
              jq --arg url "$VIOLATION_URL" '(.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .compliant) = false | (.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .lastViolation) = (now | todate)' ecosystem/registry.json > /tmp/updated.json 2>/dev/null || true
              if [ -f /tmp/updated.json ]; then
                mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/registry.json
              fi
            fi
          done
          
          # Mark verified apps as compliant
          VERIFIED=$(jq -r '.verified[].url' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json 2>/dev/null || echo "")
          for VERIFIED_URL in $VERIFIED; do
            if [ -n "$VERIFIED_URL" ]; then
              jq --arg url "$VERIFIED_URL" '(.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .compliant) = true | (.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .lastVerified) = (now | todate)' ecosystem/registry.json > /tmp/updated.json 2>/dev/null || true
              if [ -f /tmp/updated.json ]; then
                mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/registry.json
              fi
            fi
          done
          
      - name: Create violation issues
        if: steps.verify.outputs.violation_count > 0
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');
            const results = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json', 'utf8'));
            
            for (const violation of results.violations) {
              const title = `[Compliance] External contribution method detected: ${violation.url}`;
              
              // Check if issue already exists
              const existingIssues = await github.rest.issues.listForRepo({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                state: 'open',
                labels: 'compliance-violation'
              });
              
              const exists = existingIssues.data.some(issue => issue.title.includes(violation.url));
              
              if (!exists) {
                const methods = violation.findings.map(f => `- ${f.method} (${f.category})`).join('\n');
                
                const body = `## Compliance Violation Detected
            
            **App URL:** ${violation.url}
            **Detection Date:** ${new Date().toISOString()}
            
            ### External Contribution Methods Found
            
            ${methods}
            
            ---
            
            ### What This Means
            
            This app has been detected using external contribution/donation methods outside of the ecosystem's streamlined approach. Per the [Exclusive Model](./EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md), this triggers an automatic opt-out from all ecosystem benefits:
            
            - Directory listing
            - Puter browser bookmarks
            - Cross-app integration
            - Revenue sharing
            - Showcase visibility
            
            ### Resolution Options
            
            1. **Remove external methods** - Remove all external donation buttons, payment links, and FUNDING.yml to restore ecosystem eligibility
            2. **Accept opt-out** - Keep external methods and forfeit ecosystem benefits
            
            ### Appeal
            
            If you believe this is a false positive, please comment on this issue with an explanation.
            
            ---
            *This issue was automatically generated by the ecosystem compliance scanner.*`;
                
                await github.rest.issues.create({
                  owner: context.repo.owner,
                  repo: context.repo.repo,
                  title: title,
                  body: body,
                  labels: ['compliance-violation', 'automated']
                });
                
                console.log(`Created issue for: ${violation.url}`);
              }
            }
            
      - name: Generate compliance report
        run: |
          echo "# Ecosystem Compliance Report" > ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "**Generated:** $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "## Summary" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Status | Count |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "|--------|-------|" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Compliant | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.verified_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Violations | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Errors | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.error_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          
          if [ "${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }}" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "## Violations" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
            echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
            jq -r '.violations[] | "- [\(.url)](\(.url))"' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md 2>/dev/null || true
            echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          fi
          
          echo "## Compliant Apps" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          jq -r '.verified[] | "- [\(.url)](\(.url))"' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md 2>/dev/null || echo "No apps verified yet." >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          
      - name: Commit results
        run: |
          git config --local user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git config --local user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          
          git add ecosystem/ || true
          git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "Update ecosystem compliance results [skip ci]"
          git push || true
          
      - name: Summary
        run: |
          echo "## Compliance Verification Complete" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Metric | Value |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "|--------|-------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Apps Checked | ${{ steps.fetch-registry.outputs.app_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Compliant | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.verified_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Violations | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Errors | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.error_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

"}

{"references":[{"title":"Web Search Results","chunk":"Hugging Face provides a comprehensive Command Line Interface (CLI) to manage various tasks related to models, datasets, and more. The CLI has recently been updated to a more user-friendly and efficient tool named `hf`. Below is an enumeration of the primary commands available in the `hf` CLI:

**1. Authentication Management (`hf auth`)**
- **login**: Log in using a token from [huggingface.co/settings/tokens](https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens).
- **logout**: Log out from the current session.
- **whoami**: Display the currently logged-in user.
- **switch**: Switch between different access tokens.
- **list**: List all stored access tokens.

**2. Cache Management (`hf cache`)**
- **info**: Display information about the local cache directory.
- **list**: List all cached files.
- **delete**: Delete specific files from the cache.
- **clear**: Clear the entire cache.

**3. Downloading Files (`hf download`)**
- Download files from the Hugging Face Hub.
- Supports downloading specific files or entire repositories.

**4. Uploading Files (`hf upload` and `hf upload-large-folder`)**
- **upload**: Upload a file or a folder to the Hub. Recommended for single-commit uploads.
- **upload-large-folder**: Upload a large folder to the Hub. Recommended for resumable uploads.

**5. Repository Management (`hf repo` and `hf repo-files`)**
- **repo**: Manage repositories on the Hub.
  - **create**: Create a new repository.
  - **delete**: Delete an existing repository.
  - **update**: Update repository settings.
- **repo-files**: Manage files within a repository.
  - **ls**: List files in a repository.
  - **upload**: Upload files to a repository.
  - **delete**: Delete files from a repository.

**6. Job Management (`hf jobs`)**
- **run**: Run and manage jobs on the Hub.
- **ps**: List running jobs.
- **logs**: View logs of a specific job.
- **inspect**: Inspect details of a job.
- **cancel**: Cancel a running job.

**7. Environment Information (`hf env`)**
- Print information about the current environment, including system details and installed packages.

**8. Version Information (`hf version`)**
- Display the version of the `hf` CLI tool.

**9. Large File Support (`hf lfs-enable-largefiles` and `hf lfs-multipart-upload`)**
- **lfs-enable-largefiles**: Enable large file support for repositories.
- **lfs-multipart-upload**: Manage multipart uploads for large files.

For a detailed overview and the most up-to-date information on the `hf` CLI commands, you can refer to the official Hugging Face documentation: ([huggingface.co](https://huggingface.co/docs/huggingface_hub/en/guides/cli?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, if you're using the `datasets` library, there's a specific CLI tool named `datasets-cli` with commands like:

- **env**: Print relevant system environment information.
- **test**: Test dataset loading.
- **delete_from_hub**: Delete dataset configurations from the Hub.

More details on the `datasets-cli` can be found here: ([huggingface.tw](https://huggingface.tw/docs/datasets/cli?utm_source=openai))

By familiarizing yourself with these commands, you can effectively manage your models, datasets, and other resources on the Hugging Face Hub directly from the command line. "}],"isFinal":true}

data.text: The detection script is working but flagging our own ecosystem contribution link. I need to update the allowed patterns to recognize our ecosystem's contribution link:
The detection now clearly identifies footer removal as an opt-out. Let me update the workflow to handle this case with a specific issue template, then clean up:

toolFormerData.name: search_replace

codeBlocks.content:
# Exclusive Contribution Model

This document explains the exclusive contribution model used by the Puter.js Template Ecosystem.

## Core Principle

The ecosystem operates on a simple binary choice:

```
Use ONLY the template's contribution footer  ->  Get ALL ecosystem benefits
Use ANY external contribution method         ->  Lose ALL ecosystem benefits
```

There is no middle ground. This design ensures ecosystem sustainability.

---

## De Facto Opt-Out: Removing the Footer

**Removing the ecosystem footer is itself an opt-out.**

The footer contains:
- Attribution to Puter.js
- The ecosystem contribution link
- Directory navigation

If a developer removes or hides the footer, the daily compliance scan will:
1. Detect the missing footer
2. Mark the app as `FOOTER_REMOVED`
3. Remove the app from all ecosystem benefits
4. Create a GitHub issue notifying of the opt-out

This is by design. The footer is the mechanism that enables ecosystem participation.

---

## What Counts as an External Contribution Method

Any of the following will trigger automatic opt-out from the ecosystem:

### Direct Payment Platforms

| Category | Platforms |
|----------|-----------|
| GitHub-native | GitHub Sponsors |
| Coffee/Tip Jars | Ko-fi, Buy Me a Coffee, Tipeee |
| Subscription | Patreon, Polar, Flattr |
| Collectives | Open Collective, Liberapay |
| Payment Processors | PayPal Donate, PayPal.me, Stripe Payment Links, Gumroad, LemonSqueezy |
| Bank/Wire | Donorbox, Wise Payment Links, Payoneer |
| P2P Apps | Venmo, Cash App, Zelle |
| Crowdfunding | GoFundMe, JustGiving, Kickstarter, Indiegogo |

### Cryptocurrency

- Bitcoin addresses (any format)
- Ethereum/EVM addresses (0x...)
- Solana addresses
- Monero addresses
- Crypto payment processors (OpenNode, BTCPay, Coinbase Commerce)

### Widgets and Embeds

- Ko-fi widget
- Buy Me a Coffee button
- Patreon pledge button
- PayPal donate button
- Stripe buy button
- Any third-party donation widget

### Repository Indicators

- `.github/FUNDING.yml` file
- GitHub Sponsors button enabled
- Custom sponsorship links in repo settings

### Semantic Detection

The scanner also detects:
- Links with donation-related text ("donate", "sponsor", "tip", "support me", "buy me")
- Merchandise/shop links (Teespring, Redbubble, etc.)
- Affiliate links with revenue potential

---

## What You Lose by Opting Out

When ANY external contribution method is detected, you automatically lose:

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Directory Listing | Your app will not appear in the ecosystem app index |
| Puter Browser Bookmarks | Your app will not be added to Puter browser bookmarks (even at 100+ stars) |
| Cross-App Integration | Access to ecosystem integration APIs |
| Revenue Sharing | No share of contributions made through the ecosystem |
| Showcase Visibility | No listing in the community showcase |

---

## What You Keep

Even when opted-out, you can still:

- Use the Puter.js template
- Deploy to GitHub Pages
- Use all Puter.js APIs
- Keep 100% of contributions from your own methods

---

## Revenue Sharing Tiers (When Opted-In)

If you remain opted-in (using only the template footer), you're eligible for revenue sharing based on your repository's star count:

| Tier | Stars Required | Your Share |
|------|----------------|------------|
| Seedling | 0 - 99 | 0% (attribution only) |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

Revenue share is calculated per-app from contributions made through YOUR app's template attribution link.

---

## How Detection Works

### Automated Scanning

A GitHub Actions workflow runs daily to scan all registered apps:

1. Fetches the deployed app's HTML
2. Scans for external contribution patterns
3. Checks for FUNDING.yml in the repository
4. Updates compliance status in the registry

### Detection Patterns

The scanner uses regex patterns to detect:

```javascript
// Platform URLs
/ko-fi\.com/i
/buymeacoffee\.com/i
/patreon\.com/i
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i
/paypal\.com\/donate/i
// ... and many more

// Crypto addresses
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/  // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin

// Widget embeds
/kofi-widget/i
/bmc-button/i
```

### False Positive Handling

If you believe a detection is a false positive:

1. An issue will be automatically created in the template repository
2. Comment on the issue with an explanation
3. Maintainers will review and adjust if warranted

---

## Why This Model?

### Sustainability

The ecosystem needs sustainable funding to:
- Maintain the template and tooling
- Curate the app directory
- Support cross-app integration infrastructure
- Develop new features

### Fairness

- Developers who contribute to ecosystem visibility get rewarded
- Revenue share is proportional to app popularity (stars)
- Everyone plays by the same rules

### Simplicity

- One contribution method to maintain
- No complex tracking of multiple revenue streams
- Clear binary choice with no gray areas

---

## The Choice

```
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
|        OPTION A                |        OPTION B                |
|     ECOSYSTEM MEMBER           |      INDEPENDENT               |
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
|                                |                                |
| Keep ONLY template footer      | Add your own donation methods  |
|                                |                                |
| Benefits:                      | Benefits:                      |
| - Directory listing            | - Keep 100% of donations       |
| - Puter browser bookmarks      | - Use template for free        |
| - Cross-app integration        | - Full independence            |
| - Revenue share (5-30%)        |                                |
| - Showcase visibility          |                                |
|                                |                                |
| Trade-off:                     | Trade-off:                     |
| - Share ecosystem revenue      | - No ecosystem benefits        |
|                                | - No directory visibility      |
|                                | - No browser bookmarks         |
|                                |                                |
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
```

---

## Verification Status

You can check your app's compliance status:

1. **Manual Check**: Run the detection script locally
   ```bash
   node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js https://yourapp.github.io/
   ```

2. **Registry Status**: Check `ecosystem/registry.json` for your app's `compliant` field

3. **Compliance Report**: View `ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md` for the latest scan results

---

## Restoring Eligibility

If you've been flagged as non-compliant and want to rejoin:

1. Remove ALL external contribution methods from your deployed app
2. Remove any `.github/FUNDING.yml` file
3. Ensure the template footer is visible
4. Wait for the next daily compliance scan (or trigger manually)
5. Your app will be automatically restored to compliant status

---

## Questions?

If you have questions about this model:

1. Check the [FAQ](#faq) below
2. Open an issue in the template repository
3. Join the community Discord

---

## FAQ

**Q: Can I have a "Hire Me" link?**
A: Links to professional profiles (LinkedIn, personal website) are allowed as long as they don't include direct donation/payment functionality.

**Q: What about affiliate links?**
A: Affiliate links that generate revenue are considered external contribution methods and will trigger opt-out.

**Q: Can I accept cryptocurrency donations?**
A: Only through the ecosystem's contribution system (if/when implemented). Independent crypto addresses trigger opt-out.

**Q: Is the detection always accurate?**
A: The scanner aims for high accuracy but may have false positives. You can appeal via GitHub issues.

**Q: What if I remove external methods after being flagged?**
A: Your app will be automatically restored to compliant status on the next scan.

**Q: Can I opt back in after opting out?**
A: Yes, simply remove external contribution methods and the next scan will mark you compliant.

This document explains the exclusive contribution model used by the Puter.js Template Ecosystem.

## Core Principle

The ecosystem operates on a simple binary choice:

```
Use ONLY the template's contribution footer  ->  Get ALL ecosystem benefits
Use ANY external contribution method         ->  Lose ALL ecosystem benefits
```

There is no middle ground. This design ensures ecosystem sustainability.

---

## De Facto Opt-Out: Removing the Footer

**Removing the ecosystem footer is itself an opt-out.**

The footer contains:
- Attribution to Puter.js
- The ecosystem contribution link
- Directory navigation

If a developer removes or hides the footer, the daily compliance scan will:
1. Detect the missing footer
2. Mark the app as `FOOTER_REMOVED`
3. Remove the app from all ecosystem benefits
4. Create a GitHub issue notifying of the opt-out

This is by design. The footer is the mechanism that enables ecosystem participation.

---

## What Counts as an External Contribution Method

Any of the following will trigger automatic opt-out from the ecosystem:

### Direct Payment Platforms

| Category | Platforms |
|----------|-----------|
| GitHub-native | GitHub Sponsors |
| Coffee/Tip Jars | Ko-fi, Buy Me a Coffee, Tipeee |
| Subscription | Patreon, Polar, Flattr |
| Collectives | Open Collective, Liberapay |
| Payment Processors | PayPal Donate, PayPal.me, Stripe Payment Links, Gumroad, LemonSqueezy |
| Bank/Wire | Donorbox, Wise Payment Links, Payoneer |
| P2P Apps | Venmo, Cash App, Zelle |
| Crowdfunding | GoFundMe, JustGiving, Kickstarter, Indiegogo |

### Cryptocurrency

- Bitcoin addresses (any format)
- Ethereum/EVM addresses (0x...)
- Solana addresses
- Monero addresses
- Crypto payment processors (OpenNode, BTCPay, Coinbase Commerce)

### Widgets and Embeds

- Ko-fi widget
- Buy Me a Coffee button
- Patreon pledge button
- PayPal donate button
- Stripe buy button
- Any third-party donation widget

### Repository Indicators

- `.github/FUNDING.yml` file
- GitHub Sponsors button enabled
- Custom sponsorship links in repo settings

### Semantic Detection

The scanner also detects:
- Links with donation-related text ("donate", "sponsor", "tip", "support me", "buy me")
- Merchandise/shop links (Teespring, Redbubble, etc.)
- Affiliate links with revenue potential

---

## What You Lose by Opting Out

When ANY external contribution method is detected, you automatically lose:

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Directory Listing | Your app will not appear in the ecosystem app index |
| Puter Browser Bookmarks | Your app will not be added to Puter browser bookmarks (even at 100+ stars) |
| Cross-App Integration | Access to ecosystem integration APIs |
| Revenue Sharing | No share of contributions made through the ecosystem |
| Showcase Visibility | No listing in the community showcase |

---

## What You Keep

Even when opted-out, you can still:

- Use the Puter.js template
- Deploy to GitHub Pages
- Use all Puter.js APIs
- Keep 100% of contributions from your own methods

---

## Revenue Sharing Tiers (When Opted-In)

If you remain opted-in (using only the template footer), you're eligible for revenue sharing based on your repository's star count:

| Tier | Stars Required | Your Share |
|------|----------------|------------|
| Seedling | 0 - 99 | 0% (attribution only) |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

Revenue share is calculated per-app from contributions made through YOUR app's template attribution link.

---

## How Detection Works

### Automated Scanning

A GitHub Actions workflow runs daily to scan all registered apps:

1. Fetches the deployed app's HTML
2. Scans for external contribution patterns
3. Checks for FUNDING.yml in the repository
4. Updates compliance status in the registry

### Detection Patterns

The scanner uses regex patterns to detect:

```javascript
// Platform URLs
/ko-fi\.com/i
/buymeacoffee\.com/i
/patreon\.com/i
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i
/paypal\.com\/donate/i
// ... and many more

// Crypto addresses
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/  // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin

// Widget embeds
/kofi-widget/i
/bmc-button/i
```

### False Positive Handling

If you believe a detection is a false positive:

1. An issue will be automatically created in the template repository
2. Comment on the issue with an explanation
3. Maintainers will review and adjust if warranted

---

## Why This Model?

### Sustainability

The ecosystem needs sustainable funding to:
- Maintain the template and tooling
- Curate the app directory
- Support cross-app integration infrastructure
- Develop new features

### Fairness

- Developers who contribute to ecosystem visibility get rewarded
- Revenue share is proportional to app popularity (stars)
- Everyone plays by the same rules

### Simplicity

- One contribution method to maintain
- No complex tracking of multiple revenue streams
- Clear binary choice with no gray areas

---

## The Choice

```
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
|        OPTION A                |        OPTION B                |
|     ECOSYSTEM MEMBER           |      INDEPENDENT               |
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
|                                |                                |
| Keep ONLY template footer      | Add your own donation methods  |
|                                |                                |
| Benefits:                      | Benefits:                      |
| - Directory listing            | - Keep 100% of donations       |
| - Puter browser bookmarks      | - Use template for free        |
| - Cross-app integration        | - Full independence            |
| - Revenue share (5-30%)        |                                |
| - Showcase visibility          |                                |
|                                |                                |
| Trade-off:                     | Trade-off:                     |
| - Share ecosystem revenue      | - No ecosystem benefits        |
|                                | - No directory visibility      |
|                                | - No browser bookmarks         |
|                                |                                |
+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+
```

---

## Verification Status

You can check your app's compliance status:

1. **Manual Check**: Run the detection script locally
   ```bash
   node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js https://yourapp.github.io/
   ```

2. **Registry Status**: Check `ecosystem/registry.json` for your app's `compliant` field

3. **Compliance Report**: View `ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md` for the latest scan results

---

## Restoring Eligibility

If you've been flagged as non-compliant and want to rejoin:

1. Remove ALL external contribution methods from your deployed app
2. Remove any `.github/FUNDING.yml` file
3. Ensure the template footer is visible
4. Wait for the next daily compliance scan (or trigger manually)
5. Your app will be automatically restored to compliant status

---

## Questions?

If you have questions about this model:

1. Check the [FAQ](#faq) below
2. Open an issue in the template repository
3. Join the community Discord

---

## FAQ

**Q: Can I have a "Hire Me" link?**
A: Links to professional profiles (LinkedIn, personal website) are allowed as long as they don't include direct donation/payment functionality.

**Q: What about affiliate links?**
A: Affiliate links that generate revenue are considered external contribution methods and will trigger opt-out.

**Q: Can I accept cryptocurrency donations?**
A: Only through the ecosystem's contribution system (if/when implemented). Independent crypto addresses trigger opt-out.

**Q: Is the detection always accurate?**

**Q: What if I remove external methods after being flagged?**
A: Your app will be automatically restored to compliant status on the next scan.

**Q: Can I opt back in after opting out?**
A: Yes, simply remove external contribution methods and the next scan will mark you compliant.

codeBlocks.content:
# Puter.js Single-File App Template Build and deploy [Puter.js](https://puter.com) applications instantly with GitHub Pages. Join an ecosystem of developers sharing resources, visibility, and revenue. [![Use This Template](https://img.shields.io/badge/Use_This-Template-2ea44f?style=for-the-badge&logo=github)](https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template/generate) [![Directory](https://img.shields.io/badge/App-Directory-blue?style=for-the-badge)](DIRECTORY.md) [![Exclusive Model](https://img.shields.io/badge/Exclusive-Model-gold?style=for-the-badge)](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) --- ## Quick Start ``` 1. Click "Use this template" to create your repo 2. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings > Pages > Source: GitHub Actions 3. Edit index.html with your app 4. Push - your app is live! ``` --- ## The Ecosystem This template operates on an **exclusive contribution model**. You have two choices: | Option | What You Do | What You Get | |--------|-------------|--------------| | **A: Ecosystem Member** | Keep ONLY the template footer | Directory listing, browser bookmarks, cross-app integration, revenue sharing (5-30%) | | **B: Independent** | Add your own donation methods | Keep 100% of your donations, use template free, but no ecosystem benefits | **There is no middle ground.** Using ANY external donation method triggers automatic opt-out from ALL ecosystem benefits. [Read the full Exclusive Model documentation](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) --- ## Ecosystem Benefits When you keep only the template's contribution footer: | Benefit | Description | |---------|-------------| | Directory Listing | Your app listed in the curated app index | | Puter Browser Bookmarks | Featured in Puter browser at 100+ stars | | Cross-App Integration | APIs for inter-app communication | | Revenue Sharing | 5-30% of contributions via your app (based on star tier) | | Showcase Visibility | Featured in community showcase | --- ## Automatic Opt-Out Triggers Adding ANY of these will remove you from the ecosystem: - GitHub Sponsors - Ko-fi, Buy Me a Coffee, Patreon - PayPal donate buttons - Stripe payment links - Cryptocurrency addresses - FUNDING.yml file - Any donation/tip/sponsor buttons See [EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) for the complete list. --- ## Revenue Sharing Tiers | Tier | Stars | Your Share | |------|-------|------------| | Seedling | 0 - 99 | 0% (attribution only) | | Bronze | 100+ | 5% | | Silver | 1,000+ | 10% | | Gold | 10,000+ | 20% | | Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% | Revenue is per-app, based on contributions through YOUR app's attribution link. --- ## Puter.js Features Your apps have access to: - **Cloud Storage** - `puter.fs.read()`, `puter.fs.write()` - **AI Chat** - `puter.ai.chat()` with GPT, Claude, Gemini - **Image Generation** - `puter.ai.txt2img()` - **Authentication** - `puter.auth.signIn()`, `puter.auth.getUser()` - **Key-Value Store** - `puter.kv.get()`, `puter.kv.set()` - **Web Hosting** - `puter.hosting.create()` All powered by [Puter.js](https://docs.puter.com) with the "user pays" model - each user covers their own usage. --- ## Template Structure ``` puter-app-template/ |-- index.html # Your app (single-file) |-- README.md # This file |-- EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md # Contribution model docs |-- DIRECTORY.md # App directory |-- .github/ | |-- workflows/ | |-- deploy.yml # GitHub Pages deployment | |-- verify-ecosystem.yml # Compliance scanning |-- ecosystem/ | |-- registry.json # Registered apps | |-- directory.json # App index data | |-- footer.js # Footer script | |-- footer.css # Footer styles |-- scripts/ |-- detect-external-contributions.js # Compliance scanner ``` --- ## Local Development Open `index.html` directly in your browser or use a local server: ```powershell # Python python -m http.server 8000 # Node.js npx serve . # PHP php -S localhost:8000 ``` --- ## Customization ### App Content Edit the `
` section of `index.html` with your app: ```html
``` ### Styling Modify the CSS variables in `:root`: ```css :root { --primary: #6366f1; --bg: #0f0f1a; --surface: #1a1a2e; /* ... */ } ``` ### App ID Update the `data-app-id` attribute in the footer: ```html
``` --- ## Compliance Verification Check your app's compliance status: ```bash node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js https://yourapp.github.io/ ``` Output: ``` Scanning: https://yourapp.github.io/ ============================================================ COMPLIANCE REPORT ============================================================ Ecosystem Footer: PRESENT External Methods: NONE Compliance Status: COMPLIANT ============================================================ ``` --- ## Support the Ecosystem Contributions through the template footer support: - Template and tooling maintenance - App directory curation - Cross-app integration infrastructure - New feature development Developers with eligible apps receive 5-30% of contributions made through their apps. --- ## License MIT - Free to use and modify. Ecosystem benefits require visible attribution.

Join an ecosystem of developers sharing resources, visibility, and revenue. [![Use This Template](https://img.shields.io/badge/Use_This-Template-2ea44f?style=for-the-badge&logo=github)](https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template/generate) [![Directory](https://img.shields.io/badge/App-Directory-blue?style=for-the-badge)](DIRECTORY.md) [![Exclusive Model](https://img.shields.io/badge/Exclusive-Model-gold?style=for-the-badge)](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) --- ## Quick Start ``` 1. Click "Use this template" to create your repo 2. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings > Pages > Source: GitHub Actions 3. Edit index.html with your app 4. Push - your app is live! ``` --- ## The Ecosystem This template operates on an **exclusive contribution model**. You have two choices: | Option | What You Do | What You Get | |--------|-------------|--------------| | **A: Ecosystem Member** | Keep ONLY the template footer | Directory listing, browser bookmarks, cross-app integration, revenue sharing (5-30%) | | **B: Independent** | Add your own donation methods | Keep 100% of your donations, use template free, but no ecosystem benefits | **There is no middle ground.** Using ANY external donation method triggers automatic opt-out from ALL ecosystem benefits. [Read the full Exclusive Model documentation](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) --- ## Ecosystem Benefits When you keep only the template's contribution footer: | Benefit | Description | |---------|-------------| | Directory Listing | Your app listed in the curated app index | | Puter Browser Bookmarks | Featured in Puter browser at 100+ stars | | Cross-App Integration | APIs for inter-app communication | | Revenue Sharing | 5-30% of contributions via your app (based on star tier) | | Showcase Visibility | Featured in community showcase | --- ## Automatic Opt-Out Triggers Adding ANY of these will remove you from the ecosystem: - GitHub Sponsors - Ko-fi, Buy Me a Coffee, Patreon - PayPal donate buttons - Stripe payment links - Cryptocurrency addresses - FUNDING.yml file - Any donation/tip/sponsor buttons See [EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md](EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md) for the complete list. --- ## Revenue Sharing Tiers | Tier | Stars | Your Share | |------|-------|------------| | Seedling | 0 - 99 | 0% (attribution only) | | Bronze | 100+ | 5% | | Silver | 1,000+ | 10% | | Gold | 10,000+ | 20% | | Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% | Revenue is per-app, based on contributions through YOUR app's attribution link. --- ## Puter.js Features Your apps have access to: - **Cloud Storage** - `puter.fs.read()`, `puter.fs.write()` - **AI Chat** - `puter.ai.chat()` with GPT, Claude, Gemini - **Image Generation** - `puter.ai.txt2img()` - **Authentication** - `puter.auth.signIn()`, `puter.auth.getUser()` - **Key-Value Store** - `puter.kv.get()`, `puter.kv.set()` - **Web Hosting** - `puter.hosting.create()` All powered by [Puter.js](https://docs.puter.com) with the "user pays" model - each user covers their own usage. --- ## Template Structure ``` puter-app-template/ |-- index.html # Your app (single-file) |-- README.md # This file |-- EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md # Contribution model docs |-- DIRECTORY.md # App directory |-- .github/ | |-- workflows/ | |-- deploy.yml # GitHub Pages deployment | |-- verify-ecosystem.yml # Compliance scanning |-- ecosystem/ | |-- registry.json # Registered apps | |-- directory.json # App index data | |-- footer.js # Footer script | |-- footer.css # Footer styles |-- scripts/ |-- detect-external-contributions.js # Compliance scanner ``` --- ## Local Development Open `index.html` directly in your browser or use a local server: ```powershell # Python python -m http.server 8000 # Node.js npx serve . # PHP php -S localhost:8000 ``` --- ## Customization ### App Content Edit the `
` section of `index.html` with your app: ```html
``` ### Styling Modify the CSS variables in `:root`: ```css :root { --primary: #6366f1; --bg: #0f0f1a; --surface: #1a1a2e; /* ... */ } ``` ### App ID Update the `data-app-id` attribute in the footer: ```html
``` --- ## Compliance Verification Check your app's compliance status: ```bash node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js https://yourapp.github.io/ ``` Output: ``` Scanning: https://yourapp.github.io/ ============================================================ COMPLIANCE REPORT ============================================================ Ecosystem Footer: PRESENT External Methods: NONE Compliance Status: COMPLIANT ============================================================ ``` --- ## Support the Ecosystem Contributions through the template footer support: - Template and tooling maintenance - App directory curation - Cross-app integration infrastructure - New feature development Developers with eligible apps receive 5-30% of contributions made through their apps. --- ## License MIT - Free to use and modify. Ecosystem benefits require visible attribution. "}

data.text:
All decentralized components are implemented. Here's the complete system overview:

## Decentralized Ecosystem - Complete Implementation

### File Structure

```
puter-app-template/
|-- index.html                      # Main template with ecosystem footer
|-- README.md                       # Documentation
|-- EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md              # Contribution model docs
|-- DIRECTORY.md                    # App directory
|-- .gitignore
|
|-- docs/
|   |-- DECENTRALIZED_ARCHITECTURE.md   # Full architecture documentation
|
|-- lib/
|   |-- ipfs-storage.js             # IPFS integration (gateways, pinning)
|   |-- attestation-chain.js        # Signed attestation chain (no blockchain fees)
|   |-- torrent-distribution.js     # BitTorrent/magnet link distribution
|   |-- privacy-layer.js            # I2P, Tor, Lokinet integration
|   |-- ecosystem-node.js           # Main orchestrator
|
|-- scripts/
|   |-- detect-external-contributions.js  # Compliance scanner
|
|-- ecosystem/
|   |-- registry.json               # Registered apps
|   |-- directory.json              # App categories
|   |-- footer.css                  # Footer styles
|
|-- verifier/
|   |-- index.html                  # Browser-based Puter.js verifier app
|
|-- .github/
    |-- workflows/
    |   |-- deploy.yml              # GitHub Pages deployment
    |   |-- verify-ecosystem.yml    # Daily compliance verification
    |-- ISSUE_TEMPLATE/
        |-- directory-submission.yml
```

### Decentralized Layers

| Layer | Technology | Purpose |
|-------|------------|---------|
| **Storage** | IPFS, Filecoin, Arweave | Content-addressed storage for registry, chain, directory |
| **Consensus** | Attestation Chain | Signed records without blockchain fees |
| **Distribution** | BitTorrent, Magnet Links | Peer-to-peer directory distribution |
| **Privacy** | I2P, Tor, Lokinet | Anonymous submissions and verification |
| **Application** | Puter.js | Browser-based verifier with cloud storage |

### Key Features

1. **No Single Point of Failure**
   - Registry stored on IPFS (multiple gateways)
   - Attestation chain replicated across nodes
   - BitTorrent ensures data availability

2. **Cryptographic Verification**
   - Ed25519 signatures on all attestations
   - SHA256 content hashes for integrity
   - Chain of attestations prevents tampering

3. **Privacy-Preserving Operations**
   - Anonymous app submissions via I2P/Tor
   - Hidden service verifiers
   - Zero-knowledge compliance proofs

4. **Automatic Opt-Out Detection**
   - Footer removal detected as de facto opt-out
   - External contribution methods scanned daily
   - Violations create signed attestations

### Usage

```powershell
# Run ecosystem node
node lib/ecosystem-node.js start

# Verify a single app
node lib/ecosystem-node.js verify https://user.github.io/app

# Run full compliance scan
node lib/ecosystem-node.js scan

# Export all data
node lib/ecosystem-node.js export
```

The system is now fully decentralized - no central authority can censor the registry or tamper with compliance records.

## ≡ƒÆ░ Revenue Sharing Program

### How It Works

1. **Keep attribution** visible in your deployed app
2. **Donations made through YOUR app's attribution** enter your revenue pool
3. **You earn a percentage** based on your star tier:

| Tier | Stars | Your Share | You Keep |
|------|-------|------------|----------|
| ≡ƒî▒ Seedling | 0 - 99 | 0% | Attribution only |
| ≡ƒÑë Bronze | 100+ | 10% | $10 per $100 donated via your app |
| ≡ƒÑê Silver | 1,000+ | 15% | $15 per $100 donated via your app |
| ≡ƒÑç Gold | 10,000+ | 22% | $22 per $100 donated via your app |
| ≡ƒÆÄ Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% | $30 per $100 donated via your app |

### Important Clarifications
Γ£à Revenue share is based on donations through YOUR APP's attribution
Γ£à You can add your OWN donation button ΓÇö 100% of those go to YOU
Γ£à Template donations and your donations are completely separate
Γ¥î NOT a pool across all apps ΓÇö each app's donations are tracked separately

            --accent: #ff6b9d;
            --success: #4caf50;
            --gold: #ffd700;
        }
        
        * { margin: 0; padding: 0; box-sizing: border-box; }
        
        body {
            font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, sans-serif;
            background: var(--bg);
            color: var(--text);
            min-height: 100vh;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
        }
        
        /* App Content */
        #app {
            flex: 1;
            padding: 2rem;
            max-width: 960px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            width: 100%;
        }
        
        h1 { margin-bottom: 1rem; }
        
        /* Developer's own donation button (example styling) */
        .dev-donate-btn {
            background: var(--success);
            color: white;
            border: none;
            padding: 12px 24px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            font-size: 16px;
            cursor: pointer;
            margin: 1rem 0;
        }
        
        .dev-donate-btn:hover {
            background: #45a049;
        }
        
        /* ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ */
        /* TEMPLATE ATTRIBUTION STYLES - Do not remove if participating   */
        /* ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ */
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, var(--surface) 0%, var(--surface-2) 50%, var(--surface) 100%);
            border-top: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
            padding: 10px 16px;
            font-size: 12px;
            color: var(--text-muted);
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .bar-content {
            max-width: 960px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            gap: 12px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar a {
            color: var(--primary);
            text-decoration: none;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar a:hover {
            color: white;
            text-decoration: underline;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .links {
            display: flex;
            gap: 12px;
            align-items: center;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .ecosystem-link {
            display: inline-flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 4px;
            padding: 4px 10px;
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
            border-radius: 12px;
            font-size: 11px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .ecosystem-link:hover {
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
            text-decoration: none;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .support-btn {
            background: var(--accent);
            color: white;
            padding: 6px 14px;
            border-radius: 20px;
            font-weight: 500;
            display: inline-flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 6px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .support-btn:hover {
            background: #ff4f84;
            text-decoration: none;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .revenue-badge {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--gold), #ffaa00);
            color: var(--surface);
            padding: 3px 8px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            font-size: 9px;
            font-weight: 700;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            letter-spacing: 0.5px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .controls {
            display: flex;
            gap: 4px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .controls button {
            background: none;
            border: none;
            color: rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
            cursor: pointer;
            padding: 4px 6px;
            font-size: 14px;
            border-radius: 4px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .controls button:hover {
            color: rgba(255,255,255,0.8);
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
        }
        
        /* Minimized state */
        .puter-ecosystem-bar.minimized {
            padding: 6px 16px;
        }
        
        .puter-ecosystem-bar.minimized .full-view { display: none; }
        .puter-ecosystem-bar.minimized .mini-view { display: flex !important; }
        .puter-ecosystem-bar .mini-view { display: none; }
        
        /* App Index Modal */
        .puter-app-index-modal {
            display: none;
            position: fixed;
            inset: 0;
            background: rgba(0,0,0,0.8);
            z-index: 10000;
            padding: 2rem;
            overflow-y: auto;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal.open {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: flex-start;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .modal-content {
            background: var(--surface);
            border-radius: 16px;
            max-width: 800px;
            width: 100%;
            max-height: 90vh;
            overflow-y: auto;
            box-shadow: 0 20px 60px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .modal-header {
            padding: 1.5rem;
            border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            position: sticky;
            top: 0;
            background: var(--surface);
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .modal-header h2 {
            font-size: 1.25rem;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .close-btn {
            background: none;
            border: none;
            color: var(--text-muted);
            font-size: 24px;
            cursor: pointer;
            padding: 4px 8px;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .close-btn:hover {
            color: white;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .modal-body {
            padding: 1.5rem;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .category {
            margin-bottom: 2rem;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .category h3 {
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            color: var(--primary);
            margin-bottom: 0.75rem;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            letter-spacing: 1px;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(200px, 1fr));
            gap: 12px;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-card {
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.03);
            border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
            border-radius: 8px;
            padding: 12px;
            text-decoration: none;
            color: var(--text);
            transition: all 0.2s;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-card:hover {
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.08);
            border-color: var(--primary);
            transform: translateY(-2px);
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-card .app-name {
            font-weight: 600;
            margin-bottom: 4px;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-card .app-desc {
            font-size: 11px;
            color: var(--text-muted);
            line-height: 1.4;
        }
        
        .puter-app-index-modal .app-card .app-stars {
            font-size: 10px;
            color: var(--gold);
            margin-top: 6px;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    <!-- YOUR APP CONTENT                                                -->
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    
    <main id="app">
        <h1>≡ƒÜÇ My Puter.js App</h1>
        <p>Welcome to my application!</p>
        
        <!-- 
            YOUR OWN DONATION BUTTON (Optional)
            100% of donations through this go directly to you!
            This is completely separate from the template revenue share.
        -->
        <button class="dev-donate-btn" onclick="openDevDonation()">
            ≡ƒÆ¥ Support This App
        </button>
        <p style="font-size: 12px; color: var(--text-muted);">
            Donations here go directly to the developer
        </p>
        
        <!-- Your app content here -->
        
    </main>
    
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    <!-- APP INDEX MODAL                                                 -->
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    
    <div id="puter-app-index-modal" class="puter-app-index-modal">
        <div class="modal-content">
            <div class="modal-header">
                <h2>≡ƒôÜ Puter.js Ecosystem Apps</h2>
                <button class="close-btn" onclick="closeAppIndex()">├ù</button>
            </div>
            <div class="modal-body" id="app-index-content">
                <!-- Populated dynamically -->
                <p style="text-align: center; color: var(--text-muted);">Loading apps...</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
    
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    <!-- SCRIPTS                                                         -->
    <!-- ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ -->
    
    <script>
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        // CONFIGURATION - Edit this section for your app
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        
        const PUTER_TEMPLATE_CONFIG = {
            // App Info
            appName: 'My Puter App',
            appDescription: 'A brief description of what your app does',
            appCategory: 'utilities', // developer-tools, productivity, creative, utilities, games, education, etc.
            
            // Ecosystem participation (keep true for all benefits)
            ecosystem: {
                enabled: true,              // FALSE = opt out of EVERYTHING
                showAppIndex: true,         // Show link to browse other apps
                enableIntegration: true,    // Allow cross-app features
            },
            
            // Revenue sharing (donations through template attribution)
            revenueShare: {
                enabled: true,              // Set NOW - cannot enable later!
                agreedToTerms: true,        // Must be true to participate
                optInDate: 'AUTO',          // Set automatically
                projectId: null             // Generated automatically
            },
            
            // Your own donation link (100% goes to you)
            devDonation: {
                enabled: true,
                url: 'https://ko-fi.com/YOUR_KOFI',  // Or PayPal, GitHub Sponsors, etc.
                text: 'Support This App'
            },
            
            // Template links (don't change unless forking)
            template: {
                repo: 'https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/puter-app-template',
                sponsor: 'https://github.com/sponsors/YOUR_USERNAME',
                index: 'https://YOUR_USERNAME.github.io/puter-app-template/index.json',
                donate: 'https://buy.stripe.com/YOUR_PAYMENT_LINK'
            }
        };
        
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        // YOUR APP CODE
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        
        async function initApp() {
            console.log('≡ƒÜÇ App initialized!');
            
            // Your Puter.js code here
            // Example:
            // const user = await puter.auth.getUser();
            // console.log('User:', user);
        }
        
        // Developer's own donation handler
        function openDevDonation() {
            if (PUTER_TEMPLATE_CONFIG.devDonation.enabled) {
                window.open(PUTER_TEMPLATE_CONFIG.devDonation.url, '_blank');
            }
        }
        
        initApp();
        
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        // TEMPLATE ECOSYSTEM SYSTEM
        // Do not edit below unless you understand the implications
        // ΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉΓòÉ
        
        (function() {
            const CONFIG = PUTER_TEMPLATE_CONFIG;
            const STORAGE_KEY = 'puter-ecosystem-state';
            
            // Exit if ecosystem disabled
            if (!CONFIG.ecosystem.enabled) {
                console.info('[Puter Ecosystem] Opted out. No ecosystem benefits available.');
                return;
            }
            
            // Generate project ID for revenue share tracking
            if (CONFIG.revenueShare.enabled && !CONFIG.revenueShare.projectId) {
                CONFIG.revenueShare.projectId = 'pjs_' + crypto.randomUUID().split('-')[0];
            }
            
            if (CONFIG.revenueShare.enabled && CONFIG.revenueShare.optInDate === 'AUTO') {
                CONFIG.revenueShare.optInDate = new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0];
            }
            
            // Check saved state
            const savedState = localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY);
            const state = savedState ? JSON.parse(savedState) : { view: 'full' };
            
            if (state.view === 'hidden') {
                // Still participating, just hidden - log for verification
                console.info('[Puter Ecosystem] Attribution hidden by user preference');
                console.info('[Puter Ecosystem] Project ID:', CONFIG.revenueShare.projectId);
                return;
            }
            
            // Build ecosystem bar
            const bar = document.createElement('footer');
            bar.className = 'puter-ecosystem-bar' + (state.view === 'mini' ? ' minimized' : '');
            bar.id = 'puter-ecosystem-bar';
            
            bar.innerHTML = `
                <!-- Full View -->
                <div class="bar-content full-view">
                    <div>
                        Built with <a href="https://puter.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Puter.js</a>
                        via <a href="${CONFIG.template.repo}" target="_blank" rel="noopener">template</a>
                        ${CONFIG.revenueShare.enabled ? '<span class="revenue-badge">≡ƒÆ░ Rev Share</span>' : ''}
                    </div>
                    <div class="links">
                        ${CONFIG.ecosystem.showAppIndex ? `
                            <a href="#" class="ecosystem-link" onclick="openAppIndex(); return false;">
                                ≡ƒôÜ Browse Apps
                            </a>
                        ` : ''}
                        <a href="${CONFIG.template.donate}" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="support-btn">
                            ΓÖÑ Support Ecosystem
                        </a>
                        <div class="controls">
                            <button onclick="puterEcoToggle()" title="Minimize">ΓêÆ</button>
                            <button onclick="puterEcoHide()" title="Hide">├ù</button>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <!-- Minimized View -->
                <div class="bar-content mini-view">
                    <span>
                        <a href="${CONFIG.template.repo}" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Puter.js Ecosystem</a>
                        ${CONFIG.revenueShare.enabled ? '<span class="revenue-badge">≡ƒÆ░</span>' : ''}
                    </span>
                    <div class="links">
                        ${CONFIG.ecosystem.showAppIndex ? `
                            <a href="#" onclick="openAppIndex(); return false;">≡ƒôÜ</a>
                        ` : ''}
                        <a href="${CONFIG.template.donate}" target="_blank" rel="noopener">ΓÖÑ</a>
                        <div class="controls">
                            <button onclick="puterEcoToggle()" title="Expand">+</button>
                            <button onclick="puterEcoHide()" title="Hide">├ù</button>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            `;
            
            document.body.appendChild(bar);
            
            // Global functions
            window.puterEcoToggle = function() {
                const bar = document.getElementById('puter-ecosystem-bar');
                bar.classList.toggle('minimized');
                const isMinimized = bar.classList.contains('minimized');
                localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify({ view: isMinimized ? 'mini' : 'full' }));
            };
            
            window.puterEcoHide = function() {
                document.getElementById('puter-ecosystem-bar').style.display = 'none';
                localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify({ view: 'hidden' }));
            };
            
            window.openAppIndex = async function() {
                const modal = document.getElementById('puter-app-index-modal');
                modal.classList.add('open');
                
                // Load app index
                try {
                    const response = await fetch(CONFIG.template.index);
                    const data = await response.json();
                    renderAppIndex(data);
                } catch (e) {
                    document.getElementById('app-index-content').innerHTML = `
                        <p style="text-align: center; color: var(--accent);">
                            Unable to load app index. 
                            <a href="${CONFIG.template.repo}/blob/main/INDEX.md" target="_blank">View on GitHub</a>
                        </p>
                    `;
                }
            };
            
            window.closeAppIndex = function() {
                document.getElementById('puter-app-index-modal').classList.remove('open');
            };
            
            function renderAppIndex(data) {
                const container = document.getElementById('app-index-content');
                
                // Group by category
                const categories = {};
                for (const app of data.apps) {
                    if (!categories[app.category]) {
                        categories[app.category] = [];
                    }
                    categories[app.category].push(app);
                }
                
                const categoryNames = {
                    'developer-tools': '≡ƒöº Developer Tools',
                    'productivity': '≡ƒôè Productivity',
                    'creative': '≡ƒÄ¿ Creative & Design',
                    'utilities': '≡ƒöÉ Utilities',
                    'games': '≡ƒÄ« Games',
                    'education': '≡ƒôû Education',
                    'communication': '≡ƒÆ¼ Communication',
                    'finance': '≡ƒÆ░ Finance',
                    'data': '≡ƒôê Data & Analytics'
                };
                
                let html = '';
                
                for (const [category, apps] of Object.entries(categories)) {
                    html += `
                        <div class="category">
                            <h3>${categoryNames[category] || category}</h3>
                            <div class="app-grid">
                                ${apps.map(app => `
                                    <a href="${app.url}" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="app-card">
                                        <div class="app-name">${app.name}</div>
                                        <div class="app-desc">${app.description}</div>
                                        <div class="app-stars">Γ¡É ${app.stars?.toLocaleString() || 'New'}</div>
                                    </a>
                                `).join('')}
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    `;
                }
                
                container.innerHTML = html || '<p>No apps found.</p>';
            }
            
            // Close modal on background click
            document.getElementById('puter-app-index-modal').addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target === this) closeAppIndex();
            });
            
            // Log ecosystem participation
            console.info('[Puter Ecosystem] Participating in ecosystem');
            console.info('[Puter Ecosystem] Project ID:', CONFIG.revenueShare.projectId || 'Not enrolled in revenue share');
            
        })();
    </script>
    
    <!-- Verification markers - DO NOT REMOVE if participating -->
    <!-- PUTER_ECOSYSTEM_PARTICIPANT -->
    <!-- PUTER_TEMPLATE_v2 -->
</body>
</html>

text


## Why This Model?

### Fair Attribution
- Apps that bring more donations to the ecosystem through their popularity earn more
- Your contribution is directly tied to your app's success

### No Subsidizing
- You don't share YOUR donations with anyone
- You only share donations that came through the TEMPLATE's attribution link

### Aligned Incentives
- More stars = higher tier = larger share
- Encourages building great apps and maintaining attribution

## FAQ

**Q: If my app gets lots of stars but no one donates through the template link, do I get money?**

A: No. Revenue share is based on donations through your app's template attribution only. However, popular apps tend to get more donations through all channels.

**Q: Can I remove my own donation button?**

A: Your donation button is yours. Add, remove, or modify it however you want.

**Q: Can I remove the template attribution?**

A: Yes, but you lose:
- Revenue sharing eligibility
- Listing in the app index
- Cross-app integration
- Puter.js browser bookmarks
- Showcase listing

**Q: What if I want higher revenue share without the stars?**

A: The tier system is based on GitHub stars as a proxy for app value/popularity. You can always direct users to your OWN donation button for 100% of proceeds.

**Q: Is this enforced somehow?**

A: 
- Monthly automated verification checks for attribution
- Payment registration requires GitHub ownership proof
- Removing attribution automatically triggers delisting
Summary
Aspect	Description
Ecosystem Participation	Attribution enables index listing, cross-app integration, browser bookmarks
Revenue Share Source	ONLY donations through template attribution on each specific app
Developer's Own Donations	100% to developer, completely separate
Opt-Out Consequences	Loses ALL ecosystem benefits, isolated from network
Tiers	100Γ¡É=10%, 1kΓ¡É=15%, 10kΓ¡É=22%, 100kΓ¡É=30%
Verification	Monthly automated checks, delisting for non-compliance
This model creates a mutually beneficial ecosystem where:

Developers get exposure, integration, and potential revenue
Template gets attribution and sustainable funding
Users discover quality apps through the curated index
Everyone benefits from network effects

# ≡ƒÜÇ Puter.js Single-File App Template

Build and deploy [Puter.js](https://puter.com) applications instantly with GitHub Pages.
Join an ecosystem of developers sharing resources, visibility, and contributions.

# ≡ƒÆ░ Revenue Sharing Program

## ≡ƒöæ Key Clarification

> **Revenue sharing is PER-APP, not from gross contributions.**

Each app in the ecosystem has its own unique contribution tracking link. When a user
contributes through YOUR app's attribution footer, YOU receive a share of THAT contribution
based on your tier ΓÇö not a share of all contributions across all apps.

## ≡ƒôè How Contributions Are Tracked

Each opted-in app receives a unique tracking ID embedded in the attribution link:

```html
<!-- Your app's unique attribution footer -->
<a href="https://buy.stripe.com/TEMPLATE_LINK?client_reference_id=YOUR_APP_ID">
  ΓÖÑ Support Template
</a>
When someone contributes through this link:

Stripe records client_reference_id=YOUR_APP_ID
Our system attributes the contribution to your app
You receive your tier's percentage of THAT specific contribution
≡ƒÆ╡ Example: Monthly Contributions
text

App A (Silver tier, 1,500 Γ¡É):
  ΓööΓöÇ 3 contributions totaling $150
  ΓööΓöÇ Your share: 10% = $15

App B (Gold tier, 15,000 Γ¡É):
  ΓööΓöÇ 1 contribution of $500
  ΓööΓöÇ Your share: 20% = $100

App C (Bronze tier, 250 Γ¡É):
  ΓööΓöÇ 0 contributions this month
  ΓööΓöÇ Your share: $0

Template Author:
  ΓööΓöÇ Receives remainder from each contribution
  ΓööΓöÇ App A: 90% = $135
  ΓööΓöÇ App B: 80% = $400
Note: You only earn from contributions made through YOUR app, not others.

≡ƒôê Tier Structure
Tier	Stars	Your Share	Requirement
≡ƒÆÄ Diamond	100,000+	30%	Opted-in before 100 Γ¡É
≡ƒÑç Gold	10,000+	20%	Opted-in before 100 Γ¡É
≡ƒÑê Silver	1,000+	10%	Opted-in before 100 Γ¡É
≡ƒÑë Bronze	100+	5%	Opted-in before 100 Γ¡É
≡ƒî▒ Rising	1-99	0%	Attribution = Showcase only
Γ£à What You Get vs. What's Required
You Get	Required
Share of contributions via YOUR link	Opt-in before 100 Γ¡É
Directory listing	Keep attribution visible
Puter browser bookmarks	Keep attribution + 100 Γ¡É
Cross-app integrations	Keep attribution visible
Showcase visibility	Keep attribution visible
Γ₧ò Adding Your Own Donation Button
You can absolutely add your own donation/support button alongside the template attribution:

HTML

<footer>
  <!-- YOUR donation button - 100% yours -->
  <a href="https://ko-fi.com/YOUR_USERNAME">Γÿò Buy me a coffee</a>
  
  <span> ┬╖ </span>
  
  <!-- Template attribution - revenue shared -->
  <a href="https://buy.stripe.com/LINK?client_reference_id=YOUR_APP_ID">
    ΓÖÑ Support Template
  </a>
</footer>
This is encouraged! It's a clear separation:

Your button ΓåÆ Your payment link ΓåÆ 100% yours
Template link ΓåÆ Template payment ΓåÆ Shared per tier
≡ƒöì Contribution Dashboard
Opted-in partners can view their contribution stats:

text

https://TEMPLATE_AUTHOR.github.io/puter-app-template/dashboard?app=YOUR_APP_ID
(Authenticated via GitHub OAuth)

Contributions attributed to your app
