codeBlocks.content:
# Product Requirements Document (PRD)

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

## 3. System Architecture

### 3.1 Control Flow Graphs (CFG)

Complete function-level CFGs for all **119 functions** across **16 classes** are documented in:

**[CFG.md](./CFG.md)** - Full Control Flow Graphs with basic blocks, branches, and loops.

#### CFG Notation

| Symbol | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| `[Bn]` | Basic Block n |
| `-->` | Unconditional edge |
| `--T-->` | True branch (condition met) |
| `--F-->` | False branch (condition not met) |
| `--E-->` | Exception/error edge |
| `(loop)` | Back edge (loop iteration) |

#### CFG Statistics

| File | Functions | Classes | Basic Blocks |
|------|-----------|---------|--------------|
| `detect-external-contributions.js` | 7 | 1 | ~85 |
| `ipfs-storage.js` | 20 | 3 | ~120 |
| `attestation-chain.js` | 29 | 3 | ~180 |
| `torrent-distribution.js` | 16 | 3 | ~95 |
| `privacy-layer.js` | 30 | 5 | ~150 |
| `ecosystem-node.js` | 17 | 1 | ~130 |
| **Total** | **119** | **16** | **~760** |

### 3.2 System-Level Architecture Flow

```
                                    +------------------+
                                    |   DEVELOPER      |
                                    +--------+---------+
                                             |
                           [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages
                                             |
                                             v
+----------------+                  +------------------+
|  GitHub Repo   |<-- [2] Push -----|   index.html     |
|  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |
+-------+--------+                  |    footer)       |
        |                           +--------+---------+
        |                                    |
   [3] GitHub Actions                        |
   triggers deploy.yml                       |
        |                                    v
        v                           +------------------+
+----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
| Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
| Present?       |                  +--------+---------+
+-------+--------+                           |
        |                                    |
   Yes  |  No                                |
        |   +----> [App works but no         |
        |          ecosystem benefits]       |
        v                                    |
+----------------+                           |
| Submit to      |<--------------------------+
| Directory      |     [4] Developer submits via issue
+-------+--------+
        |
        v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| ECOSYSTEM NODE   |---->| IPFS Storage      |---->| Public Gateways   |
| (Scanner)        |     | (Registry, Chain) |     | (ipfs.io, etc.)   |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
         |
    [5] Daily scan via
    verify-ecosystem.yml
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Fetch App HTML   |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Run Detection    |
| Patterns         |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+
    |         |
 Compliant  Violation
    |         |
    v         v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Create | | Create Violation |
| Pass   | | Attestation      |
| Attest | +--------+---------+
+---+----+          |
    |               v
    |      +------------------+
    |      | Remove from      |
    |      | Directory        |
    |      +--------+---------+
    |               |
    +-------+-------+
            |
            v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| Sign Attestation |---->| Publish to IPFS   |---->| Announce via DHT  |
| (Ed25519)        |     +-------------------+     | (BitTorrent)      |
+------------------+                               +-------------------+
            |
            v
+------------------+
| Update Magnet    |
| Links            |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Privacy Layer    |---->| I2P/Tor Hidden    |
| (Optional)       |     | Services          |
+------------------+     +-------------------+
```

### 3.2 Data Flow

```
Developer's App (index.html)
         |
         | [Contains ecosystem footer with contribution link]
         v
+------------------+
| GitHub Pages     |
| Deployment       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [Public URL accessible]
         v
+------------------+
| Scanner Node     |
| (Fetch & Analyze)|
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [HTTP GET -> Parse HTML -> Pattern Match]
         v
+------------------+
| Compliance       |
| Result           |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+----+
    |         |    |
 Compliant  Footer External
    |       Removed Method
    |         |    |
    v         v    v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Listed | | Delisted         |
| in Dir | | (Attestation     |
+--------+ |  Created)        |
           +------------------+
```

---

## 4. File Manifest

### 4.1 Complete File List

| File Path | Type | Purpose | Lines |
|-----------|------|---------|-------|
| `index.html` | HTML | Main app template with ecosystem footer | ~350 |
| `README.md` | Markdown | Template documentation | ~150 |
| `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md` | Markdown | Contribution model rules | ~200 |
| `DIRECTORY.md` | Markdown | Human-readable app directory | ~100 |
| `.gitignore` | Config | Git ignore patterns | ~25 |
| `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` | YAML | GitHub Pages deployment | ~50 |
| `.github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml` | YAML | Daily compliance scan | ~180 |
| `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/directory-submission.yml` | YAML | App submission form | ~60 |
| `docs/DECENTRALIZED_ARCHITECTURE.md` | Markdown | Architecture documentation | ~250 |
| `docs/PRD.md` | Markdown | This document | ~800 |
| `ecosystem/registry.json` | JSON | Registered apps database | ~20 |
| `ecosystem/directory.json` | JSON | App categories and listings | ~50 |
| `ecosystem/footer.css` | CSS | Standalone footer styles | ~150 |
| `lib/ipfs-storage.js` | JavaScript | IPFS gateway and pinning | ~300 |
| `lib/attestation-chain.js` | JavaScript | Signed attestation chain | ~400 |
| `lib/torrent-distribution.js` | JavaScript | BitTorrent/magnet links | ~300 |
| `lib/privacy-layer.js` | JavaScript | I2P/Tor/Lokinet integration | ~400 |
| `lib/ecosystem-node.js` | JavaScript | Main orchestrator | ~350 |
| `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js` | JavaScript | Compliance scanner | ~400 |
| `verifier/index.html` | HTML | Browser-based verifier app | ~450 |

**Total: 20 files**

---

## 5. Module Specifications

### 5.1 `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`

#### Constants

| Name | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS` | Object | Pattern categories for detection |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.platforms` | Array | 25 payment platform patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.crypto` | Array | 5 cryptocurrency address patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.widgets` | Array | 7 embed widget patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.semanticPatterns` | Array | 2 semantic detection patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.fundingYml` | Array | 6 FUNDING.yml patterns |
| `ALLOWED_PATTERNS` | Array | 5 ecosystem-allowed patterns |
| `ECOSYSTEM_CONTRIBUTION_URLS` | Array | 2 allowed contribution URLs |

#### Classes

**`ExternalContributionDetector`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options: {verbose: boolean}` | - | Initialize detector |
| `scan` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan HTML for violations |
| `scanFundingYml` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan FUNDING.yml |
| `addFinding` | `category, method, match` | - | Add finding to results |
| `getSummary` | - | `string` | Get human-readable summary |

#### Functions

| Name | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `fetchUrl` | `url: string` | `Promise<{statusCode, body}>` | HTTP fetch with timeout |
| `main` | - | `Promise<void>` | CLI entry point |

#### Types

```typescript
interface ScanResult {
    compliant: boolean;
    hasEcosystemFooter: boolean;
    footerRemoved: boolean;
    externalMethodsDetected: boolean;
    findings: Finding[];
    summary: string;
    optOutReason: 'FOOTER_REMOVED' | 'EXTERNAL_METHODS' | null;
}

interface Finding {
    category: 'platform' | 'crypto' | 'widget' | 'semantic' | 'footer';
    method: string;
    match: string;
    timestamp: string;
}
```

---

| `CONFIG.pinTimeout` | Number | 30000ms timeout |

| `fetch` | `url, options` | `Promise<Response>` | Fetch via SOCKS proxy |
| `createHiddenService` | `port` | `Promise<{onionAddress, port}>` | Create .onion service |
| `generateOnionKeyPair` | - | `{onionAddress, publicKey, privateKey}` | Generate v3 onion |
| `newIdentity` | - | `Promise<{success, message}>` | Request new circuit |
| `getStatus` | - | `TorStatus` | Get connection status |

**`LokinetClient`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize Lokinet client |
| `connect` | - | `Promise<{connected, snodeAddress}>` | Connect to Lokinet |
| `generateSNodeAddress` | - | `string` | Generate .loki address |
| `getStatus` | - | `LokinetStatus` | Get connection status |

**`PrivacyClient`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize unified client |
| `initialize` | - | `Promise<NetworkStatuses>` | Init all networks |
| `fetch` | `url, options` | `Promise<Response>` | Fetch via best network |
| `selectNetwork` | `url` | `'i2p'\|'tor'\|'lokinet'` | Select network for URL |
| `submitAppAnonymously` | `appData` | `Promise<SubmissionResult>` | Anonymous submission |
| `verifyAppAnonymously` | `appUrl` | `Promise<VerificationResult>` | Anonymous verification |
| `getStatus` | - | `AllNetworkStatuses` | Get all statuses |
| `generateAnonymousReport` | `scanResults` | `Promise<Report>` | Privacy-preserving report |

**`HiddenServiceManager`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize manager |
| `deployVerifier` | `port` | `Promise<{tor?, i2p?}>` | Deploy on all networks |
| `getAddresses` | - | `{tor?, i2p?}` | Get hidden addresses |
| `getConnectionInstructions` | - | `Instructions` | Get user instructions |

---

### 5.6 `lib/ecosystem-node.js`

#### Classes

**`EcosystemNode`**

| Property | Type | Description |
|----------|------|-------------|
| `nodeId` | String | Unique node identifier |
| `version` | String | Node version |
| `ipfs` | EcosystemIPFS | IPFS client |
| `chain` | AttestationChain | Attestation chain |
| `scanner` | ScannerNode | Scanner node |
| `distributor` | EcosystemDistributor | BitTorrent distributor |
| `privacy` | PrivacyClient | Privacy network client |
| `hiddenServices` | HiddenServiceManager | Hidden service manager |
| `detector` | ExternalContributionDetector | Compliance detector |
| `registry` | Object | Current registry |
| `isRunning` | Boolean | Running state |
| `scanInterval` | Number | Scan interval (ms) |
| `scanTimer` | Timer | Scheduled scan timer |

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize node |
| `start` | - | `Promise<Status>` | Start node |
| `stop` | - | `Promise<void>` | Stop node |
| `syncFromIPFS` | - | `Promise<void>` | Sync from IPFS |
| `scheduleScan` | - | `void` | Schedule next scan |
| `runComplianceScan` | - | `Promise<ScanSummary>` | Run full scan |
| `scanApp` | `url` | `Promise<ScanResult>` | Scan single app |
| `fetchWithPrivacy` | `url` | `Promise<Response>` | Fetch with fallback |
| `publishResults` | - | `Promise<void>` | Publish to networks |
| `registerApp` | `appInfo` | `Promise<RegistrationResult>` | Register new app |
| `getStatus` | - | `NodeStatus` | Get node status |
| `getMagnetLinks` | - | `MagnetLinks` | Get magnet links |
| `getHiddenServiceAddresses` | - | `Addresses` | Get hidden addresses |
| `deployHiddenServices` | `port` | `Promise<Services>` | Deploy hidden services |
| `verifyChainIntegrity` | - | `IntegrityResult` | Verify chain |
| `exportData` | - | `ExportData` | Export all data |

---

## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps

### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
| template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
                                                           |
                                                           v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
| user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
         |
         | [App contains ecosystem footer]
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Developer submits|
| via GitHub Issue |
| (directory-      |
| submission.yml)  |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
| reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
|                  |     | registry.json     |
+------------------+     +--------+----------+
                                  |
                                  v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
| .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
         |                        |
         |               +--------+--------+
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
+------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
| App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
| directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
| ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
| benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
                          |                 |
                          v                 v
                   +-------------+  +------------------+
                   | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
                   | created     |  | directory        |
                   | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
                   +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
                                    +------------------+
```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

```
+------------------+
| Compliant App    |
| (footer intact,  |
| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

---

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```

---

## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

---

## 9. Revenue Model

### 9.1 Flow

```
User clicks "Support Ecosystem" in app footer
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Contribution URL |
| includes ?ref=   |
| app-id parameter |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Payment          |
| processed        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Revenue tracked  |
| per app-id       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Monthly payout   |
| based on tier    |
+------------------+
```

### 9.2 Tiers

| Tier | Stars | Revenue Share |
|------|-------|---------------|
| Seedling | 0-99 | 0% |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

---

## 10. Appendix

### 10.1 Pattern Detection Examples

```javascript
// Platform patterns (sample)
/ko-fi\.com/i                    // Ko-fi
/buymeacoffee\.com/i             // Buy Me a Coffee
/patreon\.com/i                  // Patreon
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i       // GitHub Sponsors (non-ecosystem)
/paypal\.com\/donate/i           // PayPal Donate

// Crypto patterns
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin bech32

// Allowed ecosystem patterns
/github\.com\/sponsors\/ludoplex\?ref=/i  // Ecosystem contribution
/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute
```

### 10.2 Attestation Example

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "chainId": "puter-ecosystem-compliance",
  "type": "compliance_scan",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-09T12:00:00.000Z",
  "sequence": 42,
  "previousHash": "abc123...",
  "data": {
    "scannedApps": 50,
    "compliant": 48,
    "violations": 2,
    "results": [...]
  },
  "scanner": {
    "nodeId": "scanner-node-1",
    "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----...",
    "version": "2.0.0"
  },
  "signature": "base64signature...",
  "hash": "sha256hash..."
}
```

### 10.3 Magnet Link Example

```
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:abc123...
       &dn=puter-ecosystem-registry-2026-01-09
       &tr=udp://tracker.opentrackr.org:1337/announce
       &tr=udp://tracker.openbittorrent.com:6969/announce
       &ws=https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/ecosystem/
       &ws=https://ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth/
```

---

**End of PRD**

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

## 3. System Architecture

### 3.1 Control Flow Graphs (CFG)

Complete function-level CFGs for all **119 functions** across **16 classes** are documented in:

**[CFG.md](./CFG.md)** - Full Control Flow Graphs with basic blocks, branches, and loops.

#### CFG Notation

| Symbol | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| `[Bn]` | Basic Block n |
| `-->` | Unconditional edge |
| `--T-->` | True branch (condition met) |
| `--F-->` | False branch (condition not met) |
| `--E-->` | Exception/error edge |
| `(loop)` | Back edge (loop iteration) |

#### CFG Statistics

| File | Functions | Classes | Basic Blocks |
|------|-----------|---------|--------------|
| `detect-external-contributions.js` | 7 | 1 | ~85 |
| `ipfs-storage.js` | 20 | 3 | ~120 |
| `attestation-chain.js` | 29 | 3 | ~180 |
| `torrent-distribution.js` | 16 | 3 | ~95 |
| `privacy-layer.js` | 30 | 5 | ~150 |
| `ecosystem-node.js` | 17 | 1 | ~130 |
| **Total** | **119** | **16** | **~760** |

### 3.2 System-Level Architecture Flow

```
                                    +------------------+
                                    |   DEVELOPER      |
                                    +--------+---------+
                                             |
                           [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages
                                             |
                                             v
+----------------+                  +------------------+
|  GitHub Repo   |<-- [2] Push -----|   index.html     |
|  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |
+-------+--------+                  |    footer)       |
        |                           +--------+---------+
        |                                    |
   [3] GitHub Actions                        |
   triggers deploy.yml                       |
        |                                    v
        v                           +------------------+
+----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
| Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
| Present?       |                  +--------+---------+
+-------+--------+                           |
        |                                    |
   Yes  |  No                                |
        |   +----> [App works but no         |

#### Classes

**`ExternalContributionDetector`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options: {verbose: boolean}` | - | Initialize detector |
| `scan` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan HTML for violations |
| `scanFundingYml` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan FUNDING.yml |
| `addFinding` | `category, method, match` | - | Add finding to results |
| `getSummary` | - | `string` | Get human-readable summary |

| Name | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|

#### Types

```typescript
interface ScanResult {
    compliant: boolean;
    hasEcosystemFooter: boolean;
    footerRemoved: boolean;
    externalMethodsDetected: boolean;
    findings: Finding[];
    summary: string;
    optOutReason: 'FOOTER_REMOVED' | 'EXTERNAL_METHODS' | null;
}

interface Finding {
    category: 'platform' | 'crypto' | 'widget' | 'semantic' | 'footer';
    method: string;
    match: string;
    timestamp: string;
}
```

## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps

### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
| template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
                                                           |
                                                           v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
| user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
         |
         | [App contains ecosystem footer]
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Developer submits|
| via GitHub Issue |
| (directory-      |
| submission.yml)  |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
| reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
|                  |     | registry.json     |
+------------------+     +--------+----------+
                                  |
                                  v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
| .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
         |                        |
         |               +--------+--------+
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
+------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
| App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
| directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
| ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
| benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
                          |                 |
                          v                 v
                   +-------------+  +------------------+
                   | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
                   | created     |  | directory        |
                   | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
                   +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
                                    +------------------+
```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

```
+------------------+
| Compliant App    |
| (footer intact,  |
| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```

## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

---

## 9. Revenue Model

### 9.1 Flow

```
User clicks "Support Ecosystem" in app footer
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Contribution URL |
| includes ?ref=   |
| app-id parameter |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Payment          |
| processed        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Revenue tracked  |
| per app-id       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Monthly payout   |
| based on tier    |
+------------------+
```

### 9.2 Tiers

| Tier | Stars | Revenue Share |
|------|-------|---------------|
| Seedling | 0-99 | 0% |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

---

## 10. Appendix

### 10.1 Pattern Detection Examples

```javascript
// Platform patterns (sample)
/ko-fi\.com/i                    // Ko-fi
/buymeacoffee\.com/i             // Buy Me a Coffee
/patreon\.com/i                  // Patreon
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i       // GitHub Sponsors (non-ecosystem)
/paypal\.com\/donate/i           // PayPal Donate

// Crypto patterns
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin bech32

// Allowed ecosystem patterns
/github\.com\/sponsors\/ludoplex\?ref=/i  // Ecosystem contribution
/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute
```

### 10.2 Attestation Example

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "chainId": "puter-ecosystem-compliance",
  "type": "compliance_scan",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-09T12:00:00.000Z",
  "sequence": 42,
  "previousHash": "abc123...",
  "data": {
    "scannedApps": 50,
    "compliant": 48,
    "violations": 2,
    "results": [...]
  },
  "scanner": {
    "nodeId": "scanner-node-1",
    "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----...",
    "version": "2.0.0"
  },
  "signature": "base64signature...",
  "hash": "sha256hash..."
}
```

### 10.3 Magnet Link Example

```
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:abc123...
       &dn=puter-ecosystem-registry-2026-01-09
       &tr=udp://tracker.opentrackr.org:1337/announce
       &tr=udp://tracker.openbittorrent.com:6969/announce
       &ws=https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/ecosystem/
       &ws=https://ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth/
```

---

**End of PRD**

"}

{"contents":"# Product Requirements Document (PRD)

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

## 3. System Architecture

### 3.1 Control Flow Graph (CFG)

```
                                    +------------------+
                                    |   DEVELOPER      |
                                    +--------+---------+
                                             |
                           [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages
                                             |
                                             v
+----------------+                  +------------------+
|  GitHub Repo   |<-- [2] Push -----|   index.html     |
|  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |
+-------+--------+                  |    footer)       |
        |                           +--------+---------+
        |                                    |
   [3] GitHub Actions                        |
   triggers deploy.yml                       |
        |                                    v
        v                           +------------------+
+----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
| Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
| Present?       |                  +--------+---------+
+-------+--------+                           |
        |                                    |
   Yes  |  No                                |
        |   +----> [App works but no         |
        |          ecosystem benefits]       |
        v                                    |
+----------------+                           |
| Submit to      |<--------------------------+
| Directory      |     [4] Developer submits via issue
+-------+--------+
        |
        v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| ECOSYSTEM NODE   |---->| IPFS Storage      |---->| Public Gateways   |
| (Scanner)        |     | (Registry, Chain) |     | (ipfs.io, etc.)   |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
         |
    [5] Daily scan via
    verify-ecosystem.yml
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Fetch App HTML   |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Run Detection    |
| Patterns         |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+
    |         |
 Compliant  Violation
    |         |
    v         v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Create | | Create Violation |
| Pass   | | Attestation      |
| Attest | +--------+---------+
+---+----+          |
    |               v
    |      +------------------+
    |      | Remove from      |
    |      | Directory        |
    |      +--------+---------+
    |               |
    +-------+-------+
            |
            v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| Sign Attestation |---->| Publish to IPFS   |---->| Announce via DHT  |
| (Ed25519)        |     +-------------------+     | (BitTorrent)      |
+------------------+                               +-------------------+
            |
            v
+------------------+
| Update Magnet    |
| Links            |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Privacy Layer    |---->| I2P/Tor Hidden    |
| (Optional)       |     | Services          |
+------------------+     +-------------------+
```

### 3.2 Data Flow

```
Developer's App (index.html)
         |
         | [Contains ecosystem footer with contribution link]
         v
+------------------+
| GitHub Pages     |
| Deployment       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [Public URL accessible]
         v
+------------------+
| Scanner Node     |
| (Fetch & Analyze)|
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [HTTP GET -> Parse HTML -> Pattern Match]
         v
+------------------+
| Compliance       |
| Result           |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+----+
    |         |    |
 Compliant  Footer External
    |       Removed Method
    |         |    |
    v         v    v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Listed | | Delisted         |
| in Dir | | (Attestation     |
+--------+ |  Created)        |
           +------------------+
```

---

## 4. File Manifest

### 4.1 Complete File List

| File Path | Type | Purpose | Lines |
|-----------|------|---------|-------|
| `index.html` | HTML | Main app template with ecosystem footer | ~350 |
| `README.md` | Markdown | Template documentation | ~150 |
| `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md` | Markdown | Contribution model rules | ~200 |
| `DIRECTORY.md` | Markdown | Human-readable app directory | ~100 |
| `.gitignore` | Config | Git ignore patterns | ~25 |
| `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` | YAML | GitHub Pages deployment | ~50 |
| `.github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml` | YAML | Daily compliance scan | ~180 |
| `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/directory-submission.yml` | YAML | App submission form | ~60 |
| `docs/DECENTRALIZED_ARCHITECTURE.md` | Markdown | Architecture documentation | ~250 |
| `docs/PRD.md` | Markdown | This document | ~800 |
| `ecosystem/registry.json` | JSON | Registered apps database | ~20 |
| `ecosystem/directory.json` | JSON | App categories and listings | ~50 |
| `ecosystem/footer.css` | CSS | Standalone footer styles | ~150 |
| `lib/ipfs-storage.js` | JavaScript | IPFS gateway and pinning | ~300 |
| `lib/attestation-chain.js` | JavaScript | Signed attestation chain | ~400 |
| `lib/torrent-distribution.js` | JavaScript | BitTorrent/magnet links | ~300 |
| `lib/privacy-layer.js` | JavaScript | I2P/Tor/Lokinet integration | ~400 |
| `lib/ecosystem-node.js` | JavaScript | Main orchestrator | ~350 |
| `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js` | JavaScript | Compliance scanner | ~400 |
| `verifier/index.html` | HTML | Browser-based verifier app | ~450 |

**Total: 20 files**

---

## 5. Module Specifications

### 5.1 `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`

#### Constants

| Name | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS` | Object | Pattern categories for detection |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.platforms` | Array | 25 payment platform patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.crypto` | Array | 5 cryptocurrency address patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.widgets` | Array | 7 embed widget patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.semanticPatterns` | Array | 2 semantic detection patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.fundingYml` | Array | 6 FUNDING.yml patterns |
| `ALLOWED_PATTERNS` | Array | 5 ecosystem-allowed patterns |
| `ECOSYSTEM_CONTRIBUTION_URLS` | Array | 2 allowed contribution URLs |

#### Classes

**`ExternalContributionDetector`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options: {verbose: boolean}` | - | Initialize detector |
| `scan` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan HTML for violations |
| `scanFundingYml` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan FUNDING.yml |
| `addFinding` | `category, method, match` | - | Add finding to results |
| `getSummary` | - | `string` | Get human-readable summary |

#### Functions

| Name | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `fetchUrl` | `url: string` | `Promise<{statusCode, body}>` | HTTP fetch with timeout |
| `main` | - | `Promise<void>` | CLI entry point |

#### Types

```typescript
interface ScanResult {
    compliant: boolean;
    hasEcosystemFooter: boolean;
    footerRemoved: boolean;
    externalMethodsDetected: boolean;
    findings: Finding[];
    summary: string;
    optOutReason: 'FOOTER_REMOVED' | 'EXTERNAL_METHODS' | null;
}

interface Finding {
    category: 'platform' | 'crypto' | 'widget' | 'semantic' | 'footer';
    method: string;
    match: string;
    timestamp: string;
}
```

| `registry` | Object | Current registry |
| `isRunning` | Boolean | Running state |
| `scanInterval` | Number | Scan interval (ms) |
| `scanTimer` | Timer | Scheduled scan timer |

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize node |
| `start` | - | `Promise<Status>` | Start node |
| `stop` | - | `Promise<void>` | Stop node |
| `syncFromIPFS` | - | `Promise<void>` | Sync from IPFS |
| `scheduleScan` | - | `void` | Schedule next scan |
| `runComplianceScan` | - | `Promise<ScanSummary>` | Run full scan |
| `scanApp` | `url` | `Promise<ScanResult>` | Scan single app |
| `fetchWithPrivacy` | `url` | `Promise<Response>` | Fetch with fallback |
| `publishResults` | - | `Promise<void>` | Publish to networks |
| `registerApp` | `appInfo` | `Promise<RegistrationResult>` | Register new app |
| `getStatus` | - | `NodeStatus` | Get node status |
| `getMagnetLinks` | - | `MagnetLinks` | Get magnet links |
| `getHiddenServiceAddresses` | - | `Addresses` | Get hidden addresses |
| `deployHiddenServices` | `port` | `Promise<Services>` | Deploy hidden services |
| `verifyChainIntegrity` | - | `IntegrityResult` | Verify chain |
| `exportData` | - | `ExportData` | Export all data |

---

## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps

### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
| template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
                                                           |
                                                           v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
| user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
         |
         | [App contains ecosystem footer]
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Developer submits|
| via GitHub Issue |
| (directory-      |
| submission.yml)  |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
| reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
|                  |     | registry.json     |
+------------------+     +--------+----------+
                                  |
                                  v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
| .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
         |                        |
         |               +--------+--------+
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
+------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
| App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
| directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
| ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
| benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
                          |                 |
                          v                 v
                   +-------------+  +------------------+
                   | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
                   | created     |  | directory        |
                   | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
                   +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
                                    +------------------+
```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

```
+------------------+
| Compliant App    |
| (footer intact,  |
| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

---

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```

---

## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

---

## 9. Revenue Model

### 9.1 Flow

```
User clicks "Support Ecosystem" in app footer
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Contribution URL |
| includes ?ref=   |
| app-id parameter |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Payment          |
| processed        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Revenue tracked  |
| per app-id       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Monthly payout   |
| based on tier    |
+------------------+
```

### 9.2 Tiers

| Tier | Stars | Revenue Share |
|------|-------|---------------|
| Seedling | 0-99 | 0% |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

---

## 10. Appendix

### 10.1 Pattern Detection Examples

```javascript
// Platform patterns (sample)
/ko-fi\.com/i                    // Ko-fi
/buymeacoffee\.com/i             // Buy Me a Coffee
/patreon\.com/i                  // Patreon
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i       // GitHub Sponsors (non-ecosystem)
/paypal\.com\/donate/i           // PayPal Donate

// Crypto patterns
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin bech32

// Allowed ecosystem patterns
/github\.com\/sponsors\/ludoplex\?ref=/i  // Ecosystem contribution
/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute
```

### 10.2 Attestation Example

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "chainId": "puter-ecosystem-compliance",
  "type": "compliance_scan",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-09T12:00:00.000Z",
  "sequence": 42,
  "previousHash": "abc123...",
  "data": {
    "scannedApps": 50,
    "compliant": 48,
    "violations": 2,
    "results": [...]
  },
  "scanner": {
    "nodeId": "scanner-node-1",
    "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----...",
    "version": "2.0.0"
  },
  "signature": "base64signature...",
  "hash": "sha256hash..."
}
```

### 10.3 Magnet Link Example

```
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:abc123...
       &dn=puter-ecosystem-registry-2026-01-09
       &tr=udp://tracker.opentrackr.org:1337/announce
       &tr=udp://tracker.openbittorrent.com:6969/announce
       &ws=https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/ecosystem/
       &ws=https://ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth/
```

---

**End of PRD**

codeBlocks.content:
Puter.js App Template

A serverless, cloud-powered application template

This is a template for building single-file Puter.js applications that can be deployed to GitHub Pages with zero backend infrastructure.

Features:

  • Cloud storage and file system access
  • Built-in AI capabilities (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini)
  • Authentication without backend code
  • NoSQL database (key-value store)
  • Networking and raw TCP/TLS support
  • Completely serverless - runs in the browser
View on GitHub
Built with Puter.js | ♥ Support Ecosystem | Explore Apps
Puter.js Ecosystem | ♥

This tool encompasses a variety of commands that cater to different aspects of model and dataset management. Below is an enumeration of the primary commands available in the `hf` CLI:

- **Authentication Management (`hf auth`)**:
  - `login`: Authenticate using a token from your Hugging Face account.
  - `logout`: Terminate the current authentication session.
  - `whoami`: Display the currently authenticated user.
  - `switch`: Switch between different access tokens.
  - `list`: List all stored access tokens.

- **Cache Management (`hf cache`)**:
  - `info`: Display information about the local cache.
  - `list`: List cached files.
  - `delete`: Remove specific files from the cache.
  - `clear`: Clear the entire cache.

- **Repository Management (`hf repo`)**:
  - `create`: Create a new repository on the Hugging Face Hub.
  - `delete`: Delete an existing repository.
  - `update`: Update repository settings.
  - `list`: List repositories associated with your account.

- **File Management within Repositories (`hf repo-files`)**:
  - `upload`: Upload files to a repository.
  - `delete`: Delete files from a repository.
  - `list`: List files in a repository.

- **File Operations**:
  - `download`: Download files from the Hugging Face Hub.
  - `upload`: Upload a file or folder to the Hub; recommended for single-commit uploads.
  - `upload-large-folder`: Upload a large folder to the Hub; recommended for resumable uploads.

- **Environment Information (`hf env`)**:
  - Print information about the current environment, including system details and installed packages.

- **Version Information (`hf version`)**:
  - Display the version of the `hf` CLI tool.

- **Large File Support (`hf lfs`)**:
  - `enable-largefiles`: Enable Git LFS for large file handling.
  - `multipart-upload`: Manage multipart uploads for large files.

- **Job Management (`hf jobs`)**:
  - `run`: Execute jobs on the Hugging Face infrastructure.
  - `list`: List active and completed jobs.
  - `cancel`: Cancel a running job.
  - `logs`: Retrieve logs for a specific job.

- **Inference Endpoints Management (`hf endpoints`)**:
  - `ls`: List existing inference endpoints.
  - `deploy`: Deploy a new inference endpoint.
  - `describe`: Get details about a specific inference endpoint.
  - `pause`: Pause an active inference endpoint.
  - `delete`: Delete an inference endpoint.

For a detailed overview and the most up-to-date information on each command, you can refer to the official Hugging Face documentation: ([huggingface.co](https://huggingface.co/docs/huggingface_hub/en/guides/cli?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, running `hf --help` in your terminal will provide a comprehensive list of commands and their descriptions. "}],"isFinal":true}

codeBlocks.content:
# Product Requirements Document (PRD)

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

## 3. System Architecture

### 3.1 Control Flow Graph (CFG)

```
                                    +------------------+
                                    |   DEVELOPER      |
                                    +--------+---------+
                                             |
                           [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages
                                             |
                                             v
+----------------+                  +------------------+
|  GitHub Repo   |<-- [2] Push -----|   index.html     |
|  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |
+-------+--------+                  |    footer)       |
        |                           +--------+---------+
        |                                    |
   [3] GitHub Actions                        |
   triggers deploy.yml                       |
        |                                    v
        v                           +------------------+
+----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
| Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
| Present?       |                  +--------+---------+
+-------+--------+                           |
        |                                    |
   Yes  |  No                                |
        |   +----> [App works but no         |
        |          ecosystem benefits]       |
        v                                    |
+----------------+                           |
| Submit to      |<--------------------------+
| Directory      |     [4] Developer submits via issue
+-------+--------+
        |
        v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| ECOSYSTEM NODE   |---->| IPFS Storage      |---->| Public Gateways   |
| (Scanner)        |     | (Registry, Chain) |     | (ipfs.io, etc.)   |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
         |
    [5] Daily scan via
    verify-ecosystem.yml
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Fetch App HTML   |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Run Detection    |
| Patterns         |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+
    |         |
 Compliant  Violation
    |         |
    v         v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Create | | Create Violation |
| Pass   | | Attestation      |
| Attest | +--------+---------+
+---+----+          |
    |               v
    |      +------------------+
    |      | Remove from      |
    |      | Directory        |
    |      +--------+---------+
    |               |
    +-------+-------+
            |
            v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
| Sign Attestation |---->| Publish to IPFS   |---->| Announce via DHT  |
| (Ed25519)        |     +-------------------+     | (BitTorrent)      |
+------------------+                               +-------------------+
            |
            v
+------------------+
| Update Magnet    |
| Links            |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Privacy Layer    |---->| I2P/Tor Hidden    |
| (Optional)       |     | Services          |
+------------------+     +-------------------+
```

### 3.2 Data Flow

```
Developer's App (index.html)
         |
         | [Contains ecosystem footer with contribution link]
         v
+------------------+
| GitHub Pages     |
| Deployment       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [Public URL accessible]
         v
+------------------+
| Scanner Node     |
| (Fetch & Analyze)|
+--------+---------+
         |
         | [HTTP GET -> Parse HTML -> Pattern Match]
         v
+------------------+
| Compliance       |
| Result           |
+--------+---------+
         |
    +----+----+----+
    |         |    |
 Compliant  Footer External
    |       Removed Method
    |         |    |
    v         v    v
+--------+ +------------------+
| Listed | | Delisted         |
| in Dir | | (Attestation     |
+--------+ |  Created)        |
           +------------------+
```

---

## 4. File Manifest

### 4.1 Complete File List

| File Path | Type | Purpose | Lines |
|-----------|------|---------|-------|
| `index.html` | HTML | Main app template with ecosystem footer | ~350 |
| `README.md` | Markdown | Template documentation | ~150 |
| `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md` | Markdown | Contribution model rules | ~200 |
| `DIRECTORY.md` | Markdown | Human-readable app directory | ~100 |
| `.gitignore` | Config | Git ignore patterns | ~25 |
| `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` | YAML | GitHub Pages deployment | ~50 |

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |

#### Types

```typescript
interface ScanResult {
    compliant: boolean;
    hasEcosystemFooter: boolean;
    footerRemoved: boolean;
    externalMethodsDetected: boolean;
    findings: Finding[];
    summary: string;
    optOutReason: 'FOOTER_REMOVED' | 'EXTERNAL_METHODS' | null;
}

interface Finding {
    category: 'platform' | 'crypto' | 'widget' | 'semantic' | 'footer';
    method: string;
    match: string;
    timestamp: string;
}
```

## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps

### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
| template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
                                                           |
                                                           v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
| user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
         |
         | [App contains ecosystem footer]
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Developer submits|
| via GitHub Issue |
| (directory-      |
| submission.yml)  |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
| reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
|                  |     | registry.json     |
+------------------+     +--------+----------+
                                  |
                                  v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
| .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
         |                        |
         |               +--------+--------+
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
+------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
| App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
| directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
| ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
| benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
                          |                 |
                          v                 v
                   +-------------+  +------------------+
                   | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
                   | created     |  | directory        |
                   | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
                   +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
                                    +------------------+
```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

```
+------------------+
| Compliant App    |
| (footer intact,  |
| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```
