## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

// Platform patterns (sample)

/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum

// Allowed ecosystem patterns

/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

## 3. System Architecture

### 3.1 Control Flow Graph (CFG)

                           [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages

|  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |

        |                                    |
   [3] GitHub Actions                        |
   triggers deploy.yml                       |
        |                                    v
        v                           +------------------+
+----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
| Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
| Present?       |                  +--------+---------+

   Yes  |  No                                |

        v                                    |

| Submit to      |<--------------------------+
| Directory      |     [4] Developer submits via issue
+-------+--------+

| ECOSYSTEM NODE   |---->| IPFS Storage      |---->| Public Gateways   |
| (Scanner)        |     | (Registry, Chain) |     | (ipfs.io, etc.)   |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+

    [5] Daily scan via
    verify-ecosystem.yml

| Fetch App HTML   |

```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

+------------------+
| Compliant App    |

| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

---

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```

---

## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

---

## 9. Revenue Model

### 9.1 Flow

```
User clicks "Support Ecosystem" in app footer
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Contribution URL |
| includes ?ref=   |
| app-id parameter |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Payment          |
| processed        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Revenue tracked  |
| per app-id       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Monthly payout   |
| based on tier    |
+------------------+
```

### 9.2 Tiers

| Tier | Stars | Revenue Share |
|------|-------|---------------|
| Seedling | 0-99 | 0% |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

---

## 10. Appendix

### 10.1 Pattern Detection Examples

```javascript
// Platform patterns (sample)
/ko-fi\.com/i                    // Ko-fi
/buymeacoffee\.com/i             // Buy Me a Coffee
/patreon\.com/i                  // Patreon
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i       // GitHub Sponsors (non-ecosystem)
/paypal\.com\/donate/i           // PayPal Donate

// Crypto patterns
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin bech32

// Allowed ecosystem patterns
/github\.com\/sponsors\/ludoplex\?ref=/i  // Ecosystem contribution
/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute
```

### 10.2 Attestation Example

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "chainId": "puter-ecosystem-compliance",
  "type": "compliance_scan",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-09T12:00:00.000Z",
  "sequence": 42,
  "previousHash": "abc123...",
  "data": {
    "scannedApps": 50,
    "compliant": 48,
    "violations": 2,
    "results": [...]
  },
  "scanner": {
    "nodeId": "scanner-node-1",
    "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----...",
    "version": "2.0.0"
  },
  "signature": "base64signature...",
  "hash": "sha256hash..."
}
```

### 10.3 Magnet Link Example

```
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:abc123...
       &dn=puter-ecosystem-registry-2026-01-09
       &tr=udp://tracker.opentrackr.org:1337/announce
       &tr=udp://tracker.openbittorrent.com:6969/announce
       &ws=https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/ecosystem/
       &ws=https://ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth/
```

---

**End of PRD**
"}

+ # Product Requirements Document (PRD)
+ 
+ ## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform
+ 
+ **Version:** 2.0.0  
+ **Date:** 2026-01-09  
+ **Status:** Implementation Complete
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## 1. Executive Summary
+ 
+ The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## 2. Product Overview
+ 
+ ### 2.1 Problem Statement
+ 
+ Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
+ - Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
+ - A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
+ - Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship
+ 
+ ### 2.2 Solution
+ 
+ A template repository that:
+ 1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
+ 2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
+ 3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
+ 4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience
+ 
+ ### 2.3 Target Users
+ 
+ | User Type | Description |
+ |-----------|-------------|
+ | App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
+ | End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
+ | Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## 3. System Architecture
+ 
+ ### 3.1 Control Flow Graph (CFG)
+ 
+ ```
+                                     +------------------+
+                                     |   DEVELOPER      |
+                                     +--------+---------+
+                                              |
+                            [1] Uses template, deploys to GitHub Pages
+                                              |
+                                              v
+ +----------------+                  +------------------+
+ |  GitHub Repo   |<-- [2] Push -----|   index.html     |
+ |  (Template)    |                  | (with ecosystem  |
+ +-------+--------+                  |    footer)       |
+         |                           +--------+---------+
+         |                                    |
+    [3] GitHub Actions                        |
+    triggers deploy.yml                       |
+         |                                    v
+         v                           +------------------+
+ +----------------+                  |  GitHub Pages    |
+ | Verify Footer  |                  |  (Live App URL)  |
+ | Present?       |                  +--------+---------+
+ +-------+--------+                           |
+         |                                    |
+    Yes  |  No                                |
+         |   +----> [App works but no         |
+         |          ecosystem benefits]       |
+         v                                    |
+ +----------------+                           |
+ | Submit to      |<--------------------------+
+ | Directory      |     [4] Developer submits via issue
+ +-------+--------+
+         |
+         v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
+ | ECOSYSTEM NODE   |---->| IPFS Storage      |---->| Public Gateways   |
+ | (Scanner)        |     | (Registry, Chain) |     | (ipfs.io, etc.)   |
+ +--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
+          |
+     [5] Daily scan via
+     verify-ecosystem.yml
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Fetch App HTML   |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Run Detection    |
+ | Patterns         |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+     +----+----+
+     |         |
+  Compliant  Violation
+     |         |
+     v         v
+ +--------+ +------------------+
+ | Create | | Create Violation |
+ | Pass   | | Attestation      |
+ | Attest | +--------+---------+
+ +---+----+          |
+     |               v
+     |      +------------------+
+     |      | Remove from      |
+     |      | Directory        |
+     |      +--------+---------+
+     |               |
+     +-------+-------+
+             |
+             v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+     +-------------------+
+ | Sign Attestation |---->| Publish to IPFS   |---->| Announce via DHT  |
+ | (Ed25519)        |     +-------------------+     | (BitTorrent)      |
+ +------------------+                               +-------------------+
+             |
+             v
+ +------------------+
+ | Update Magnet    |
+ | Links            |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+
+ | Privacy Layer    |---->| I2P/Tor Hidden    |
+ | (Optional)       |     | Services          |
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 3.2 Data Flow
+ 
+ ```
+ Developer's App (index.html)
+          |
+          | [Contains ecosystem footer with contribution link]
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | GitHub Pages     |
+ | Deployment       |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          | [Public URL accessible]
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Scanner Node     |
+ | (Fetch & Analyze)|
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          | [HTTP GET -> Parse HTML -> Pattern Match]
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Compliance       |
+ | Result           |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+     +----+----+----+
+     |         |    |
+  Compliant  Footer External
+     |       Removed Method
+     |         |    |
+     v         v    v
+ +--------+ +------------------+
+ | Listed | | Delisted         |
+ | in Dir | | (Attestation     |
+ +--------+ |  Created)        |
+            +------------------+
+ ```
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## 4. File Manifest
+ 
+ ### 4.1 Complete File List
+ 
+ | File Path | Type | Purpose | Lines |
+ |-----------|------|---------|-------|

+ | `ecosystem/directory.json` | JSON | App categories and listings | ~50 |

+ | `lib/attestation-chain.js` | JavaScript | Signed attestation chain | ~400 |
+ | `lib/torrent-distribution.js` | JavaScript | BitTorrent/magnet links | ~300 |

+ | `verifier/index.html` | HTML | Browser-based verifier app | ~450 |
+ 
+ **Total: 20 files**

+ ---

+ ## 5. Module Specifications
+ 
+ ### 5.1 `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`

+ ## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps
+ 
+ ### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem
+ 
+ ```
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
+ | Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
+ | template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
+                                                            |
+                                                            v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
+ | App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
+ | user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+ +--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
+          |
+          | [App contains ecosystem footer]
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Developer submits|
+ | via GitHub Issue |
+ | (directory-      |
+ | submission.yml)  |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+
+ | Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
+ | reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
+ |                  |     | registry.json     |
+ +------------------+     +--------+----------+
+                                   |
+                                   v
+ +------------------+     +-------------------+
+ | verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
+ | .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+ +--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
+          |                        |
+          |               +--------+--------+
+          |               |                 |
+          v               v                 v
+ +------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
+ | App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
+ | directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
+ | ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
+ | benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+ +------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
+                           |                 |
+                           v                 v
+                    +-------------+  +------------------+
+                    | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
+                    | created     |  | directory        |
+                    | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
+                    +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
+                                     +------------------+
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App
+ 
+ The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:
+ 
+ ```html
+ <footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
+         data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
+         data-app-id="my-app-name">
+     
+     <!-- Attribution -->
+     <span class="eco-built-with">
+         Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
+     </span>
+     
+     <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
+     
+     <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
+     <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
+        class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
+        data-contribution-tracked="true">
+         <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
+         Support Ecosystem
+     </a>
+     
+     <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
+     
+     <!-- Directory link -->
+     <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
+        class="eco-directory-link">
+         Explore Apps
+     </a>
+ </footer>
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 6.3 Detection Interface
+ 
+ The scanner fetches the app and checks for:
+ 
+ | Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
+ |-------|---------|------------------------|
+ | Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
+ | Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
+ | Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
+ | External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
+ | External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
+ | External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
+ | Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
+ | ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
+ 
+ ### 6.4 Benefits Flow
+ 
+ ```
+ +------------------+
+ | Compliant App    |
+ | (footer intact,  |
+ | no external      |
+ | methods)         |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
+          |
+          +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
+          |
+          +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
+          |
+          +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
+          |
+          +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
+          |
+          +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
+          |
+          +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps
+ 
+ Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:
+ 
+ ```javascript
+ // Available in every ecosystem app
+ 
+ window.__puterEcosystem = {
+     version: '2.0.0',
+     config: {
+         templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
+         contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
+         directoryUrl: '...',
+         apiEndpoint: '...'
+     },
+     
+     // Toggle footer visibility
+     toggle(): void,
+     hide(): void,
+     show(): void,
+     
+     // Get this app's ID
+     getAppId(): string,
+     
+     // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
+     getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
+     
+     // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
+     openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
+ };
+ ```
+

+ ## 7. Decentralized Data Access
+ 
+ ### 7.1 Access Methods
+ 
+ | Method | URL Pattern | Description |
+ |--------|-------------|-------------|
+ | GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
+ | IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
+ | IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
+ | BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
+ | I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
+ | Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |
+ 
+ ### 7.2 Data Redundancy
+ 
+ ```
+                     +------------------+
+                     |   Source Data    |
+                     | (registry.json,  |
+                     |  chain, etc.)    |
+                     +--------+---------+
+                              |
+          +-------------------+-------------------+
+          |                   |                   |
+          v                   v                   v
+ +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
+ | GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
+ | (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+ +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
+          |                   |                   |
+          v                   v                   v
+ +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
+ | CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
+ |                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+ +------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
+ ```
+

+ ## 8. Security Model
+ 
+ ### 8.1 Attestation Verification
+ 
+ ```
+ +------------------+
+ | Received         |
+ | Attestation      |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
+ | and chainId      |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
+ | public key       |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
+ | signature        |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
+ | hash             |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
+ | linkage          |
+ +--------+---------+
+          |
+          v
+ +------------------+
+ | Accept           |
+ | attestation      |
+ +------------------+
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 8.2 Trust Model
+ 
+ | Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
+ |--------|-------------|--------------|
+ | Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
+ | Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
+ | Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
+ | Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |
+

## Puter.js Template Ecosystem - Decentralized App Discovery Platform

**Version:** 2.0.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem provides a GitHub template repository that enables developers to deploy single-file Puter.js applications to GitHub Pages with automatic inclusion in a decentralized app discovery network. Apps retain ecosystem benefits (directory listing, browser bookmarks, revenue sharing) only when using the exclusive contribution model.

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 Problem Statement

Developers building Puter.js apps lack:
- Discoverability among other Puter.js applications
- A sustainable revenue model for open-source work
- Decentralized infrastructure resistant to censorship

### 2.2 Solution

A template repository that:
1. Provides instant deployment to GitHub Pages
2. Automatically registers apps in a decentralized directory
3. Offers revenue sharing through exclusive attribution
4. Uses IPFS, BitTorrent, and privacy networks for resilience

### 2.3 Target Users

| User Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| App Developers | Build Puter.js apps using the template |
| End Users | Discover and use ecosystem apps |
| Node Operators | Run verification and distribution nodes |

---

 Compliant  Violation

## 5. Module Specifications

### 5.1 `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`

#### Constants

| Name | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS` | Object | Pattern categories for detection |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.platforms` | Array | 25 payment platform patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.crypto` | Array | 5 cryptocurrency address patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.widgets` | Array | 7 embed widget patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.semanticPatterns` | Array | 2 semantic detection patterns |
| `DETECTION_PATTERNS.fundingYml` | Array | 6 FUNDING.yml patterns |
| `ALLOWED_PATTERNS` | Array | 5 ecosystem-allowed patterns |
| `ECOSYSTEM_CONTRIBUTION_URLS` | Array | 2 allowed contribution URLs |

#### Classes

**`ExternalContributionDetector`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options: {verbose: boolean}` | - | Initialize detector |
| `scan` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan HTML for violations |
| `scanFundingYml` | `content: string` | `ScanResult` | Scan FUNDING.yml |
| `addFinding` | `category, method, match` | - | Add finding to results |
| `getSummary` | - | `string` | Get human-readable summary |

#### Functions

| Name | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `fetchUrl` | `url: string` | `Promise<{statusCode, body}>` | HTTP fetch with timeout |
| `main` | - | `Promise<void>` | CLI entry point |

#### Types

```typescript
interface ScanResult {
    compliant: boolean;
    hasEcosystemFooter: boolean;
    footerRemoved: boolean;
    externalMethodsDetected: boolean;
    findings: Finding[];
    summary: string;
    optOutReason: 'FOOTER_REMOVED' | 'EXTERNAL_METHODS' | null;
}

interface Finding {
    category: 'platform' | 'crypto' | 'widget' | 'semantic' | 'footer';
    method: string;
    match: string;
    timestamp: string;
}
```

### 5.2 `lib/ipfs-storage.js`

#### Constants

| Name | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `CONFIG.gateways` | Array | 5 public IPFS gateway URLs |
| `CONFIG.ipnsNames` | Object | IPNS names for ecosystem data |
| `CONFIG.pinningServices` | Array | 3 pinning service configs |
| `CONFIG.gatewayTimeout` | Number | 10000ms timeout |
| `CONFIG.pinTimeout` | Number | 30000ms timeout |

#### Classes

**`IPFSGateway`**

| Method | Parameters | Returns | Description |
|--------|------------|---------|-------------|
| `constructor` | `options` | - | Initialize with gateways |

## 6. Interface with Deployed Apps

### 6.1 How Apps Join the Ecosystem

```
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| Developer forks  |---->| Customizes        |---->| Pushes to GitHub |
| template repo    |     | index.html        |     | (triggers deploy)|
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +--------+---------+
                                                           |
                                                           v
+------------------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
| App live at      |<----| GitHub Actions    |<----| deploy.yml runs  |
| user.github.io   |     | deploys to Pages  |     |                  |
+--------+---------+     +-------------------+     +------------------+
         |
         | [App contains ecosystem footer]
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Developer submits|
| via GitHub Issue |
| (directory-      |
| submission.yml)  |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| Maintainer       |---->| App added to      |
| reviews & merges |     | ecosystem/        |
|                  |     | registry.json     |
+------------------+     +--------+----------+
                                  |
                                  v
+------------------+     +-------------------+
| verify-ecosystem |---->| Scans app HTML    |
| .yml runs daily  |     | for compliance    |
+--------+---------+     +--------+----------+
         |                        |
         |               +--------+--------+
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
+------------------+ +--------+    +------------------+
| App remains in   | |Compliant    | Violation found  |
| directory with   | +--------+    | (footer removed  |
| ecosystem        |      |        | or external      |
| benefits         |      |        | methods added)   |
+------------------+      |        +--------+---------+
                          |                 |
                          v                 v
                   +-------------+  +------------------+
                   | Attestation |  | App REMOVED from |
                   | created     |  | directory        |
                   | (success)   |  | Attestation      |
                   +-------------+  | created (fail)   |
                                    +------------------+
```

### 6.2 Ecosystem Footer in App

The footer in `index.html` is the key interface:

```html
<footer class="puter-ecosystem-footer" 
        data-ecosystem-version="2.0" 
        data-app-id="my-app-name">
    
    <!-- Attribution -->
    <span class="eco-built-with">
        Built with <a href="https://puter.com">Puter.js</a>
    </span>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- EXCLUSIVE contribution link (tracked per-app) -->
    <a href="https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex?ref=puter-ecosystem-my-app-name" 
       class="ecosystem-contribution-link"
       data-contribution-tracked="true">
        <span class="eco-heart">♥</span>
        Support Ecosystem
    </a>
    
    <span class="eco-sep">|</span>
    
    <!-- Directory link -->
    <a href="https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/DIRECTORY.html"
       class="eco-directory-link">
        Explore Apps
    </a>
</footer>
```

### 6.3 Detection Interface

The scanner fetches the app and checks for:

| Check | Pattern | Result if Missing/Found |
|-------|---------|------------------------|
| Footer present | `puter-ecosystem-footer` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Footer version | `data-ecosystem-version` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| Contribution link | `ecosystem-contribution-link` | FOOTER_REMOVED |
| External Ko-fi | `ko-fi.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External Patreon | `patreon.com` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| External PayPal | `paypal.com/donate` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| Crypto addresses | `0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}` | EXTERNAL_METHODS |
| ... | (25+ more patterns) | EXTERNAL_METHODS |

### 6.4 Benefits Flow

```
+------------------+
| Compliant App    |
| (footer intact,  |
| no external      |
| methods)         |
+--------+---------+
         |
         +---> [Listed in ecosystem/directory.json]
         |
         +---> [Listed in DIRECTORY.md]
         |
         +---> [Included in BitTorrent distribution]
         |
         +---> [Available via IPFS gateways]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for Puter browser bookmarks (100+ stars)]
         |
         +---> [Eligible for revenue sharing (5-30%)]
         |
         +---> [Cross-app integration via __puterEcosystem API]
```

### 6.5 JavaScript API Exposed to Apps

Apps can use `window.__puterEcosystem`:

```javascript
// Available in every ecosystem app

window.__puterEcosystem = {
    version: '2.0.0',
    config: {
        templateRepo: 'https://github.com/ludoplex/puter-app-template',
        contributionUrl: 'https://github.com/sponsors/ludoplex',
        directoryUrl: '...',
        apiEndpoint: '...'
    },
    
    // Toggle footer visibility
    toggle(): void,
    hide(): void,
    show(): void,
    
    // Get this app's ID
    getAppId(): string,
    
    // Fetch ecosystem directory (from IPFS)
    getDirectory(): Promise<Directory>,
    
    // Open another ecosystem app with referral tracking
    openApp(appUrl: string, params?: object): void
};
```

---

## 7. Decentralized Data Access

### 7.1 Access Methods

| Method | URL Pattern | Description |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| GitHub Pages | `ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/...` | Primary HTTP access |
| IPFS Gateway | `ipfs.io/ipfs/{CID}` | Content-addressed access |
| IPNS | `ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth` | Mutable IPFS names |
| BitTorrent | `magnet:?xt=urn:btih:...` | P2P distribution |
| I2P | `puterecosystem.b32.i2p` | Anonymous access |
| Tor | `puter....onion` | Anonymous access |

### 7.2 Data Redundancy

```
                    +------------------+
                    |   Source Data    |
                    | (registry.json,  |
                    |  chain, etc.)    |
                    +--------+---------+
                             |
         +-------------------+-------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| GitHub Pages     | | IPFS Pinning     | | BitTorrent DHT   |
| (HTTP)           | | (Multiple pins)  | | (P2P)            |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
         |                   |                   |
         v                   v                   v
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
| CDN Cache        | | Public Gateways  | | Peer Nodes       |
|                  | | (ipfs.io, etc.)  | |                  |
+------------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+
```

---

## 8. Security Model

### 8.1 Attestation Verification

```
+------------------+
| Received         |
| Attestation      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check version    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| and chainId      |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Lookup scanner   |----> [Reject if unknown]
| public key       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify Ed25519   |----> [Reject if invalid]
| signature        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Verify SHA256    |----> [Reject if mismatch]
| hash             |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Check chain      |----> [Reject if broken]
| linkage          |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Accept           |
| attestation      |
+------------------+
```

### 8.2 Trust Model

| Entity | Trust Level | Verification |
|--------|-------------|--------------|
| Scanner Nodes | Registered | Public key in chain |
| Attestations | Cryptographic | Ed25519 + SHA256 |
| Content | Content-addressed | CID verification |
| Apps | Scan-based | Pattern matching |

---

## 9. Revenue Model

### 9.1 Flow

```
User clicks "Support Ecosystem" in app footer
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Contribution URL |
| includes ?ref=   |
| app-id parameter |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Payment          |
| processed        |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Revenue tracked  |
| per app-id       |
+--------+---------+
         |
         v
+------------------+
| Monthly payout   |
| based on tier    |
+------------------+
```

### 9.2 Tiers

| Tier | Stars | Revenue Share |
|------|-------|---------------|
| Seedling | 0-99 | 0% |
| Bronze | 100+ | 5% |
| Silver | 1,000+ | 10% |
| Gold | 10,000+ | 20% |
| Diamond | 100,000+ | 30% |

---

## 10. Appendix

### 10.1 Pattern Detection Examples

```javascript
// Platform patterns (sample)
/ko-fi\.com/i                    // Ko-fi
/buymeacoffee\.com/i             // Buy Me a Coffee
/patreon\.com/i                  // Patreon
/github\.com\/sponsors\//i       // GitHub Sponsors (non-ecosystem)
/paypal\.com\/donate/i           // PayPal Donate

// Crypto patterns
/\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/        // Ethereum
/\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/  // Bitcoin bech32

// Allowed ecosystem patterns
/github\.com\/sponsors\/ludoplex\?ref=/i  // Ecosystem contribution
/puter-ecosystem-footer/i                  // Footer class
/data-ecosystem-version/i                  // Footer attribute
```

### 10.2 Attestation Example

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "chainId": "puter-ecosystem-compliance",
  "type": "compliance_scan",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-09T12:00:00.000Z",
  "sequence": 42,
  "previousHash": "abc123...",
  "data": {
    "scannedApps": 50,
    "compliant": 48,
    "violations": 2,
    "results": [...]
  },
  "scanner": {
    "nodeId": "scanner-node-1",
    "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----...",
    "version": "2.0.0"
  },
  "signature": "base64signature...",
  "hash": "sha256hash..."
}
```

### 10.3 Magnet Link Example

```
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:abc123...
       &dn=puter-ecosystem-registry-2026-01-09
       &tr=udp://tracker.opentrackr.org:1337/announce
       &tr=udp://tracker.openbittorrent.com:6969/announce
       &ws=https://ludoplex.github.io/puter-app-template/ecosystem/
       &ws=https://ipfs.io/ipns/registry.puter-ecosystem.eth/
```

---

**End of PRD**

"}

# Product Requirements Document
## Puter.js Template Ecosystem

**Version:** 2.0  
**Date:** 2026-01-09  
**Status:** Implementation Complete

---

## 1. Executive Summary

The Puter.js Template Ecosystem is a GitHub template repository that enables developers to instantly deploy serverless web applications with built-in cloud capabilities. Apps built from this template automatically participate in a decentralized discovery network, gaining visibility through directory listings, browser bookmarks, and cross-app integration - all in exchange for displaying a small attribution footer.

### Value Proposition

| For Developers | For the Ecosystem |
|----------------|-------------------|
| Zero-config deployment to GitHub Pages | Sustainable funding through contribution sharing |
| Instant access to Puter.js cloud APIs | Growing network of discoverable apps |
| Automatic discovery through app directory | Decentralized, censorship-resistant infrastructure |
| Revenue sharing based on app popularity | Quality control through compliance verification |

---

## 2. Product Overview

### 2.1 What It Is

A single-file HTML template (`index.html`) that developers fork to create Puter.js applications. The template includes:

1. **Puter.js SDK integration** - Cloud storage, AI, authentication, databases
2. **Ecosystem footer** - Attribution and contribution link
3. **Ecosystem API** - Cross-app communication and directory access

### 2.2 How It Works

```
Developer Journey:
==================

1. FORK TEMPLATE
   |
   |  Developer clicks "Use this template" on GitHub
   |
   v
2. CUSTOMIZE APP
   |
   |  Edit index.html with their application code
   |  Keep ecosystem footer visible
   |
   v
3. ENABLE GITHUB PAGES
   |
   |  Settings > Pages > Source: GitHub Actions
   |
   v
4. PUSH CODE
   |
   |  App is deployed to username.github.io/repo
   |
   v

**`docs/CFG.md`** - Contains actual CFGs with:
- Basic blocks (`[Bn]`) representing sequences of straight-line code
- Conditional branches (`--T-->` for true, `--F-->` for false)
- Loop back edges (`(loop)`)
- Exception edges (`--E-->`)
- Entry and exit points for each function

For example, here's a portion of the `scan()` function CFG:

data.cachedConversationSummary:
{"summary":"Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
The user wants a complete specification for the Puter.js Template Ecosystem, including an ecosystem overview, revenue model clarification, and updated `README.md`, `INDEX.md`, `index.html`, `index.json`, `bookmarks.json`, `bookmarks.html`, and `REVENUE_SHARING.md` files. The user also specifically requested to enumerate all methods of receiving contributions on their own, and provide an easy and convenient way to integrate them alongside the template's ask/note for contributions. This integration should allow developers to retain ecosystem benefits, but any other method besides the provided streamlined one should result in an automatic opt-out. Additionally, the user requested a sanity check of the implementation against Puter.js documentation and the `ludoplex/puter.js-github-pages-hosted-client-app-template` repository, and to remove the "no data mining or tracking" disclaimer.

The user then requested to implement an automated system for the ecosystem, suggesting the use of Puter.js itself, decentralized database systems like IPFS, a FLOSS blockchain, BitTorrent, magnet links, and I2P.

Most recently, the user asked for a description of how the decentralized system interfaces with the resulting Puter.js apps provided by the GitHub template repo, which offers convenient deployment with added discovery benefits.

2. Key Technical Concepts:
- Puter.js: A JavaScript library for serverless, cloud-powered applications.
- GitHub Pages: Hosting for single-file web applications.
- Ecosystem Benefits: App Index, Cross-App Integration, Puter.js Browser Bookmarks, Revenue Sharing, Showcase Listing, Service Discovery.
- Revenue Model: Per-app revenue sharing based on GitHub stars, with separate developer-owned donation options.
- Attribution: Required for ecosystem participation.
- GitHub Actions: Automated workflows for deployment, CI/CD, and milestone promotion.
- JSON and Markdown: Formats for app directory and documentation.
- Browser Bookmarks: JSON and HTML formats for Puter.js browser integration.
- Stripe: Implied payment processor for template contributions.
- Decentralized Architecture: IPFS, Filecoin, Arweave for storage; Attestation Chain for consensus; BitTorrent/Magnet Links for distribution; I2P/Tor/Lokinet for privacy.
- Cryptographic Verification: Ed25519 signatures, SHA256 content hashes.

3. Files and Code Sections:
- `https://github.com/ludoplex/puter.js-github-pages-hosted-client-app-template`: The original template repository that was reviewed.
- `index.html`: The core of the Puter.js single-file application template. It includes the Puter.js script, basic app content, and a dynamically generated ecosystem attribution bar. The user provided a complete `index.html` template with updated styling, a new `PUTER_TEMPLATE_CONFIG` object for app configuration, and a JavaScript section for ecosystem integration logic. This file was updated to include the exclusive ecosystem footer.
- `README.md`: The user provided a complete `README.md` for the template, detailing the quick start, ecosystem advantages, app directory, revenue sharing program, Puter.js browser integration, community showcase, and support. It was updated to remove "no tracking" claims.
- `DIRECTORY.md`: This file is the full app index, categorizing various Puter.js applications. The user provided a complete `INDEX.md` (renamed to `DIRECTORY.md`) with categories like Developer Tools, Productivity, Creative & Design, Utilities, Games & Entertainment, Education, Communication, Finance, and Data & Analytics.
- `ecosystem/directory.json`: This JSON file serves as the machine-readable app index for ecosystem browsing. The user provided a complete `index.json` (renamed to `ecosystem/directory.json`) with app details, categories, and statistics.
- `ecosystem/registry.json`: A new file created to store the registry of compliant apps.
- `ecosystem/footer.css`: A new file created for the standalone ecosystem footer styles.
- `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`: This script was created to scan deployed apps for external donation/contribution methods.
  - It includes `DETECTION_PATTERNS` for platforms, crypto addresses, widgets, semantic keywords, and `FUNDING.yml` indicators.
  - It also includes `ALLOWED_PATTERNS` to whitelist the ecosystem's own contribution link.
  - The script was updated to explicitly detect the removal of the ecosystem footer as an opt-out reason.
  - The module exports were updated to include `ExternalContributionDetector`, `DETECTION_PATTERNS`, and `ALLOWED_PATTERNS`.
  ```javascript
  // ============================================================================
  // EXTERNAL CONTRIBUTION DETECTION PATTERNS
  // ============================================================================

  const DETECTION_PATTERNS = {
      // Direct Payment Platforms (truncated for brevity)
      platforms: [
          { pattern: /github\.com\/sponsors\//i, name: 'GitHub Sponsors' },
          { pattern: /ko-fi\.com/i, name: 'Ko-fi' },
          // ... many more
      ],
      
      // Cryptocurrency Wallet Addresses (truncated for brevity)
      crypto: [
          { pattern: /\b(bc1[a-zA-HJ-NP-Z0-9]{39,59})\b/, name: 'Bitcoin (bech32)' },
          { pattern: /\b(0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40})\b/, name: 'Ethereum/EVM Address' },
          // ... more crypto patterns
      ],
      
      // Widget Embeds (truncated for brevity)
      widgets: [
          { pattern: /kofi-widget/i, name: 'Ko-fi Widget' },
          // ... more widget patterns
      ],
      
      // Semantic Keywords Near Links (truncated for brevity)
      semanticPatterns: [
          { 
              pattern: /<a[^>]*href=[^>]*>.*?\b(donate|donation|tip|sponsor|support\s*me|buy\s*me|fund|contribute)\b.*?<\/a>/gi, 
              name: 'Donation Link Text' 
          },
      ],
      
      // FUNDING.yml indicators (when scanning repo) (truncated for brevity)
      fundingYml: [
          { pattern: /\.github\/FUNDING\.yml/i, name: 'FUNDING.yml Present' },
      ]
  };

  // Patterns that are ALLOWED (ecosystem contribution link)
  const ALLOWED_PATTERNS = [
      /data-ecosystem-version/i,
      /puter-ecosystem-footer/i,
      /ecosystem-contribution-link/i,
      /\?ref=puter-ecosystem/i,
      /class=["'].*ecosystem.*["']/i,
      /buy\.stripe\.com\/\w+\?client_reference_id=\w+/i // Specific pattern for the ecosystem's Stripe link
  ];

  // ... (rest of the class and main function)

  // Export for use as module
  module.exports = {
      ExternalContributionDetector,
      DETECTION_PATTERNS,
      ALLOWED_PATTERNS
  };
  ```
- `.github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml`: This GitHub Actions workflow was created to run daily compliance verification. It was updated to handle `FOOTER_REMOVED` as a specific opt-out reason and create a corresponding issue.
  ```yaml
  # .github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml
  name: Verify Ecosystem Compliance

  on:
    schedule:
      - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily
    workflow_dispatch:

  jobs:
    verify:
      runs-on: ubuntu-latest
      steps:
        - name: Checkout repository
          uses: actions/checkout@v3

        - name: Setup Node.js
          uses: actions/setup-node@v3
          with:
            node-version: '16'

        - name: Install dependencies
          run: npm install # if any, for the script

        - name: Fetch registered apps
          id: fetch_apps
          run: |
            # In a real scenario, this would fetch from a decentralized registry (IPFS/blockchain)
            # For now, we'll use a placeholder or local file
            echo "::set-output name=apps::$(cat ecosystem/registry.json)"

        - name: Scan for external contributions
          id: scan_app
          run: |
            # Assuming the app URL is known or can be constructed
            # For this example, we'll scan a local index.html for demonstration
            node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js ./index.html --json > compliance_report.json
            echo "::set-output name=report::$(cat compliance_report.json)"

        - name: Process compliance report
          run: |
            REPORT=$(cat compliance_report.json)
            COMPLIANT=$(echo $REPORT | jq -r '.compliant')
            OPT_OUT_REASON=$(echo $REPORT | jq -r '.optOutReason')
            APP_ID="your-app-id" # This would be dynamically determined per app

            if [ "$COMPLIANT" = "false" ]; then
              echo "App $APP_ID is NON-COMPLIANT. Reason: $OPT_OUT_REASON"
              if [ "$OPT_OUT_REASON" = "FOOTER_REMOVED" ]; then
                ISSUE_TITLE="Ecosystem Footer Removed - De Facto Opt-Out for $APP_ID"
                ISSUE_BODY="The Puter.js ecosystem footer was detected as removed from app $APP_ID. This constitutes a de facto opt-out from the ecosystem benefits. Please refer to EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md for details."
              else
                ISSUE_TITLE="Compliance Violation Detected for $APP_ID"
                FINDINGS=$(echo $REPORT | jq -r '.findings | map("- [" + .category + "] " + .method) | join("\n")')
                ISSUE_BODY="External contribution methods were detected in app $APP_ID. This violates the exclusive contribution model. Detected methods:\n$FINDINGS\n\nPlease refer to EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md for details."
              fi

              # Create GitHub Issue
              curl -X POST -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}" \
                   -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
                   https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/issues \
                   -d "$(jq -n --arg title "$ISSUE_TITLE" --arg body "$ISSUE_BODY" '{title: $title, body: $body, labels: ["compliance-violation"]}')"
            else
              echo "App $APP_ID is COMPLIANT."
            fi
  ```
- `.github/workflows/deploy.yml`: A new file created for GitHub Pages deployment.
- `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/directory-submission.yml`: A new file created for the app submission template.
- `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md`: A new file created to document the exclusive contribution model, detailing opt-out triggers and benefits. It was updated to explicitly mention footer removal as an opt-out trigger.
- `.gitignore`: A new file created for standard ignore patterns.
- `docs/DECENTRALIZED_ARCHITECTURE.md`: A new file created to document the decentralized architecture.
- `lib/ipfs-storage.js`: A new file created for IPFS integration (gateways, pinning).
- `lib/attestation-chain.js`: A new file created for the signed attestation chain (no blockchain fees).
- `lib/torrent-distribution.js`: A new file created for BitTorrent/magnet link distribution.
- `lib/privacy-layer.js`: A new file created for I2P, Tor, Lokinet integration.
- `lib/ecosystem-node.js`: A new file created as the main orchestrator for the decentralized ecosystem.
- `verifier/index.html`: A new file created for a browser-based Puter.js verifier app.

4. Errors and fixes:
- **Error**: `Error: Failed to create Browserbase session: Failed to ensure default session browserbase_session_main_1767909894860 after initial error and retry: Failed to create/connect session browserbase_session_main_1767909894860: Unauthorized. Ensure you provided a valid API key and that it is whitelisted.`
  - **Fix**: This error indicated an issue with API key authorization for Browserbase. The assistant did not fix this error but proceeded with other available information, as it was an environmental error not directly related to the code being developed.
- **Error**: `Error calling tool: Unable to write file '\index.html' (NoPermissions (FileSystemError): Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\index.html')`
  - **Fix**: The assistant attempted to write `index.html` to the root directory `C:\`. This was corrected by first creating a dedicated directory `puter-app-template` in the user's home directory and then writing all files within that new directory.
- **Error**: `Copy-Item : Cannot find path 'C:\Users\user\puter-app-template\scripts\detect-external-contributions.js' because it does not exist.`
  - **Fix**: This error occurred because the `detect-external-contributions.js` file was not yet created in the target directory when the `Copy-Item` command was executed. The assistant then created the file directly in the correct path.
- **Error**: The detection script initially flagged the ecosystem's own contribution link as an external method.
  - **Fix**: The `ALLOWED_PATTERNS` in `scripts/detect-external-contributions.js` were updated to specifically whitelist the ecosystem's Stripe payment link pattern, ensuring it is not incorrectly identified as a violation.

5. Problem Solving:
- The initial problem was to define a complete ecosystem specification and an exclusive contribution model. This was addressed by creating detailed documentation (`README.md`, `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md`), a compliance detection script (`scripts/detect-external-contributions.js`), and a GitHub Actions workflow (`.github/workflows/verify-ecosystem.yml`) for automated enforcement.
- A specific user query about a developer removing the payment and verification part (ecosystem footer) was addressed by enhancing the `detect-external-contributions.js` script to explicitly check for the presence of the ecosystem footer and report its absence as a `FOOTER_REMOVED` opt-out reason. The GitHub Actions workflow and `EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md` were updated to reflect this.
- The user then requested to implement a decentralized automated system. This was addressed by designing and implementing several modules for IPFS storage, an attestation chain, BitTorrent distribution, and a privacy layer (I2P/Tor), all orchestrated by a central `ecosystem-node.js`. A `DECENTRALIZED_ARCHITECTURE.md` document was also created.

toolFormerData.result: {"selectedTool":"hf_doc_search","result":"{\"content\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"# Documentation Library Search Results for \\\"Puter.js API documentation getting started\\\"\\n\\nFound 10 results\\n## Results for Product: hub (4 results)\\n\\n\\n### Results from [Getting Started with Repositories](https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/repositories-getting-started) (3 results)\\n\\n\\n#### Excerpts from the \\\"Adding files to a repository (Web UI)\\\" section\\n\\nIf you choose _Upload file_ you'll be able to choose a local file to upload, along with a message summarizing your changes to the repo \\nAs with creating new files, you can select `Open as a pull request` to create a [Pull Request](./repositories-pull-requests-discussions) instead of adding your changes directly to the `main` branch of your repo\\n\\nChoosing to create a new file will take you to the following editor screen, where you can choose a name for your file, add content, and save your file with a message that summarizes your changes Instead of directly committing the new file to your repo's `main` branch, you can select `Open as a pull request` to create a [Pull Request](./repositories-pull-requests-discussions)\\n\\nTo add files to your repository via the web UI, start by selecting the **Files** tab, navigating to the desired directory, and then clicking **Add file** You'll be given the option to create a new file or upload a file directly from your computer\\n\\n### Results from [Repositories](https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/repositories)\\n\\n\\n#### Excerpt from the \\\"Contents\\\" section\\n\\n- [Getting Started with Repositories](./repositories-getting-started)\\n- [Settings](./repositories-settings)\\n- [Pull Requests & Discussions](./repositories-pull-requests-discussions)\\n  - [Pull Requests advanced usage](./repositories-pull-requests-discussions#pull-requests-advanced-usage)\\n- [Webhooks](./webhooks)\\n- [Notifications](./notifications)\\n- [Collections](./collections)\\n- [Storage Backends](./storage-backends)\\n- [Storage Limits](./storage-limits)\\n- [Next Steps](./repositories-next-steps)\\n- [Licenses](./repositories-licenses)\\n## Results for Product: transformers.js (4 results)\\n\\n\\n### Results from [Transformers.js](https://huggingface.co/docs/transformers.js/index)\\n\\n\\n#### Excerpt from the \\\"Contents\\\" section\\n\\nThe documentation is organized into 4 sections:\\n1 **GET STARTED** provides a quick tour of the library and installation instructions to get up and running 2 **TUTORIALS** are a great place to start if you're a beginner! We also include sample applications for you to play around with!\\n3 **DEVELOPER GUIDES** show you how to use the library to achieve a specific goal 4 **API REFERENCE** describes all classes and functions, as well as their available parameters and types\\n\\n### Results from [Server-side Inference in Node.js](https://huggingface.co/docs/transformers.js/tutorials/node)\\n\\n\\n#### Excerpt from the \\\"Creating a basic HTTP server\\\" section\\n\\nNext, let's create a basic server with the built-in [HTTP](https://nodejs.org/api/http.html#http) module We will listen for requests made to the server (using the `/classify` endpoint), extract the `text` query parameter, and run this through the pipeline ```javascript\\n// Define the HTTP server\\nconst server = http.createServer();\\nconst hostname = '127.0.0.1';\\nconst port = 3000;\\n// Listen for requests made to the server\\nserver.on('request', async (req, res) => {\\n  // Parse the request URL\\n  const parsedUrl = url.parse(req.url);\\n  // Extract the query parameters\\n  const { text } = querystring.parse(parsedUrl.query);\\n  // Set the response headers\\n  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');\\n  let response;\\n  if (parsedUrl.pathname === '/classify' && text) {\\n    const classifier = await MyClassificationPipeline.getInstance();\\n    response = await classifier(text);\\n    res.statusCode = 200;\\n  } else {\\n    response = { 'error': 'Bad request' }\\n    res.statusCode = 400;\\n  }\\n  // Send the JSON response\\n  res.end(JSON.stringify(response));\\n});\\nserver.listen(port, hostname, () => {\\n  console.log(`Server running at http://${hostname}:${port}/`);\\n});\\n``` \\nSince we use lazy loading, the first request made to the server will also be responsible for loading the pipeline If you would like to begin loading the pipeline as soon as the server starts running, you can add the following line of code after defining `MyClassificationPipeline`: ```javascript\\nMyClassificationPipeline.getInstance();\\n``` \\nTo start the server, run the following command: ```bash\\nnode app.js\\n``` The server should be live at http://127.0.0.1:3000/, which you can visit in your web browser You should see the following message: ```json\\n{\\\"error\\\":\\\"Bad request\\\"}\\n``` This is because we aren't targeting the `/classify` endpoint with a valid `text` query parameter Let's try again, this time with a valid request For example, you can visit start writing some JavaScript code! The PRD is complete. Here's what it contains:

## PRD Summary

**Location:** `C:\Users\user\puter-app-template\docs\PRD.md`

### Contents

| Section | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **1. Executive Summary** | Problem, solution, target users |
| **2. Product Overview** | High-level product description |
| **3. System Architecture** | Complete CFG with ASCII diagrams showing control flow |
| **4. File Manifest** | All 20 files with paths, types, and purposes |
| **5. Module Specifications** | Every function, method, class, and constant for each module |
| **6. Interface with Deployed Apps** | How the ecosystem connects to apps via footer |
| **7. Decentralized Data Access** | All access methods (GitHub, IPFS, BitTorrent, I2P, Tor) |
| **8. Security Model** | Attestation verification flow and trust model |
| **9. Revenue Model** | Contribution tracking and tier-based sharing |
| **10. Appendix** | Pattern examples, attestation format, magnet link format |

### CFG Highlights

The Control Flow Graph shows:

```
Developer -> Template -> GitHub Pages -> Scanner -> Compliance Check
                                              |
                              +---------------+---------------+

                         Compliant                       Violation
                              |                               |
                         Listed in                     Removed from
                         Directory                     Directory
                              |                               |
                         Attestation                   Attestation
                         (success)                     (failure)
                              |                               |
                         IPFS + BitTorrent + Privacy Networks
```

### All Variables/Functions Documented

Each module includes tables listing:
- **Constants** with types and descriptions
- **Classes** with all methods, parameters, and return types
- **Functions** with signatures
- **TypeScript-style interfaces** for complex types

codeBlocks.content:
name: Verify Ecosystem Compliance

on:
  schedule:
    # Run daily at midnight UTC
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      specific_app:
        description: 'Specific app URL to verify (optional)'
        required: false
        type: string

permissions:
  contents: write
  issues: write

jobs:
  verify-compliance:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          
      - name: Fetch ecosystem registry
        id: fetch-registry
        run: |
          echo "Fetching registered apps from ecosystem registry..."
          
          # Create ecosystem directory if it doesn't exist
          mkdir -p ecosystem
          
          # Try to fetch existing registry, or create empty one
          if [ -f "ecosystem/registry.json" ]; then
            echo "Using existing registry"
          else
            echo '{"apps":[],"lastUpdated":"'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"}' > ecosystem/registry.json
          fi
          
          # Count registered apps
          APP_COUNT=$(jq '.apps | length' ecosystem/registry.json)
          echo "app_count=$APP_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
      - name: Run compliance verification
        id: verify
        run: |
          echo "Running compliance verification..."
          
          # Create results directory
          mkdir -p ecosystem/compliance-results
          
          # Initialize results
          echo '{"verified":[],"violations":[],"errors":[],"timestamp":"'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"}' > ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
          
          # Check if we have a specific app to verify
          SPECIFIC_APP="${{ github.event.inputs.specific_app }}"
          
          if [ -n "$SPECIFIC_APP" ]; then
            echo "Verifying specific app: $SPECIFIC_APP"
            node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js "$SPECIFIC_APP" --json > /tmp/result.json 2>&1 || true
            
            # Check result
            if jq -e '.compliant == true' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
              echo "App is COMPLIANT"
              jq --arg url "$SPECIFIC_APP" '.verified += [{"url": $url, "timestamp": now | todate}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
              mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
            else
              echo "App has VIOLATIONS"
              FINDINGS=$(jq -c '.findings' /tmp/result.json 2>/dev/null || echo '[]')
              jq --arg url "$SPECIFIC_APP" --argjson findings "$FINDINGS" '.violations += [{"url": $url, "findings": $findings, "timestamp": now | todate}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
              mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
            fi
          else
            echo "Verifying all registered apps..."
            
            # Iterate through registered apps
            jq -r '.apps[].url' ecosystem/registry.json 2>/dev/null | while read -r APP_URL; do
              if [ -n "$APP_URL" ]; then
                echo "Checking: $APP_URL"
                
                # Run detection (with timeout)
                timeout 30 node scripts/detect-external-contributions.js "$APP_URL" --json > /tmp/result.json 2>&1 || true
                
                # Process result
                if jq -e '.compliant == true' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" '.verified += [{"url": $url}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                elif jq -e '.error' /tmp/result.json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                  ERROR_MSG=$(jq -r '.error' /tmp/result.json)
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" --arg err "$ERROR_MSG" '.errors += [{"url": $url, "error": $err}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                else
                  FINDINGS=$(jq -c '.findings' /tmp/result.json 2>/dev/null || echo '[]')
                  jq --arg url "$APP_URL" --argjson findings "$FINDINGS" '.violations += [{"url": $url, "findings": $findings}]' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json > /tmp/updated.json
                  mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json
                fi
              fi
            done
          fi
          
          # Generate summary
          VERIFIED_COUNT=$(jq '.verified | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          VIOLATION_COUNT=$(jq '.violations | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          ERROR_COUNT=$(jq '.errors | length' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json)
          
          echo "verified_count=$VERIFIED_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "violation_count=$VIOLATION_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "error_count=$ERROR_COUNT" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
      - name: Update compliance registry
        run: |
          echo "Updating compliance status in registry..."
          
          # Read violations
          VIOLATIONS=$(jq -r '.violations[].url' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json 2>/dev/null || echo "")
          
          # Update registry with compliance status
          for VIOLATION_URL in $VIOLATIONS; do
            if [ -n "$VIOLATION_URL" ]; then
              echo "Marking as non-compliant: $VIOLATION_URL"
              jq --arg url "$VIOLATION_URL" '(.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .compliant) = false | (.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .lastViolation) = (now | todate)' ecosystem/registry.json > /tmp/updated.json 2>/dev/null || true
              if [ -f /tmp/updated.json ]; then
                mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/registry.json
              fi
            fi
          done
          
          # Mark verified apps as compliant
          VERIFIED=$(jq -r '.verified[].url' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json 2>/dev/null || echo "")
          for VERIFIED_URL in $VERIFIED; do
            if [ -n "$VERIFIED_URL" ]; then
              jq --arg url "$VERIFIED_URL" '(.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .compliant) = true | (.apps[] | select(.url == $url) | .lastVerified) = (now | todate)' ecosystem/registry.json > /tmp/updated.json 2>/dev/null || true
              if [ -f /tmp/updated.json ]; then
                mv /tmp/updated.json ecosystem/registry.json
              fi
            fi
          done
          
      - name: Create violation issues
        if: steps.verify.outputs.violation_count > 0
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');
            const results = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json', 'utf8'));
            
            for (const violation of results.violations) {
              const title = `[Compliance] External contribution method detected: ${violation.url}`;
              
              // Check if issue already exists
              const existingIssues = await github.rest.issues.listForRepo({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                state: 'open',
                labels: 'compliance-violation'
              });
              
              const exists = existingIssues.data.some(issue => issue.title.includes(violation.url));
              
              if (!exists) {
                const methods = violation.findings.map(f => `- ${f.method} (${f.category})`).join('\n');
                
                const body = `## Compliance Violation Detected
            
            **App URL:** ${violation.url}
            **Detection Date:** ${new Date().toISOString()}
            
            ### External Contribution Methods Found
            
            ${methods}
            
            ---
            
            ### What This Means
            
            This app has been detected using external contribution/donation methods outside of the ecosystem's streamlined approach. Per the [Exclusive Model](./EXCLUSIVE_MODEL.md), this triggers an automatic opt-out from all ecosystem benefits:
            
            - Directory listing
            - Puter browser bookmarks
            - Cross-app integration
            - Revenue sharing
            - Showcase visibility
            
            ### Resolution Options
            
            1. **Remove external methods** - Remove all external donation buttons, payment links, and FUNDING.yml to restore ecosystem eligibility
            2. **Accept opt-out** - Keep external methods and forfeit ecosystem benefits
            
            ### Appeal
            
            If you believe this is a false positive, please comment on this issue with an explanation.
            
            ---
            *This issue was automatically generated by the ecosystem compliance scanner.*`;
                
                await github.rest.issues.create({
                  owner: context.repo.owner,
                  repo: context.repo.repo,
                  title: title,
                  body: body,
                  labels: ['compliance-violation', 'automated']
                });
                
                console.log(`Created issue for: ${violation.url}`);
              }
            }
            
      - name: Generate compliance report
        run: |
          echo "# Ecosystem Compliance Report" > ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "**Generated:** $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "## Summary" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Status | Count |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "|--------|-------|" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Compliant | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.verified_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Violations | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "| Errors | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.error_count }} |" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          
          if [ "${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }}" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "## Violations" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
            echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
            jq -r '.violations[] | "- [\(.url)](\(.url))"' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md 2>/dev/null || true
            echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          fi
          
          echo "## Compliant Apps" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          echo "" >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          jq -r '.verified[] | "- [\(.url)](\(.url))"' ecosystem/compliance-results/latest.json >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md 2>/dev/null || echo "No apps verified yet." >> ecosystem/COMPLIANCE_REPORT.md
          
      - name: Commit results
        run: |
          git config --local user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git config --local user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          
          git add ecosystem/ || true
          git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "Update ecosystem compliance results [skip ci]"
          git push || true
          
      - name: Summary
        run: |
          echo "## Compliance Verification Complete" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Metric | Value |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "|--------|-------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Apps Checked | ${{ steps.fetch-registry.outputs.app_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Compliant | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.verified_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Violations | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.violation_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "| Errors | ${{ steps.verify.outputs.error_count }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
